0.title: Pune schools to remain shut on July 14 in view of heavy rain
0.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation has announced that all schools under its jurisdiction will remain shut on Thursday in view of heavy rain prediction in the region. However, the teaching and non-teaching staff of all civic schools will have to report to their respective schools to take part in disaster management-related work of the PMC.

1.title: Singapore viewed as an attractive target for terror attacks: Govt
1.article_body: The Singapore government on Wednesday said that the city-state is viewed as an "attractive target" for terror attacks by both foreign terror outfits and lone radicalised actors. The Internal Security Department (ISD) in its annual report said that terrorists may make their way to new conflict zones after the pandemic. The government has asked citizens to remain on high alert.

2.title: Man arrested for raising peacocks at his residence in Karnataka; adult bird seized
2.article_body: A man identified as Manju Nayak has been arrested on charges of raising peacocks at his residence in Kamegowdanahalli village in Karnataka's Mysuru district. The peacock is India’s national bird and is protected under the Indian Wildlife Act 1972. During a raid at Manju's residence by the Mobile Vigilance Squad of the Karnataka Forest Department, an adult peacock was seized.

3.title: Haryana to build science city on 50 acres of land in Gurugram
3.article_body: The Haryana government will set up a science city on around 50 acres of land in Gurugram, an official statement said. The project will be completed with the help of the Centre, it added. Once it's set up, students from the state and other parts of the country would get an opportunity to practically learn scientific principles, an official said.

4.title: Man gets 20 yrs rigorous imprisonment for sexually assaulting 2 girls in Guj
4.article_body: A special court in Gujarat's Rajkot district sentenced a man to 20 years of rigorous imprisonment for sexually assaulting two minor girls. The girls, aged three and five years, were playing alone near their houses when the accused lured and assaulted them, Public Prosecutor Ghanshyam Dobariya said. The incident was reported in Rajkot's Gondal taluka on May 20 this year.

5.title: I'm filing a complaint against Team India, jokes Mahindra over quick win vs England
5.article_body: After a total of 44 overs were played in first ODI between England and India, with India chasing down the target in 18.4 overs, Anand Mahindra jokingly tweeted, "I'm filing a complaint against Team India for such a brutally dominant victory in such a short time." He added, "Because by the time I switched on the TV...the match was done."

6.title: Pet pitbull dog attacks, kills 82-year-old woman owner in Lucknow
6.article_body: An 82-year-old woman was mauled to death by her pet dog at her house in Lucknow, police said on Wednesday. According to police, Sushila Tripathi, a retired school teacher, was on the roof of her house on Tuesday morning when her pitbull attacked her. The domestic help found her lying in a pool of blood and informed her son.

7.title: Greek news outlet targeted in arson attack
7.article_body: The office of Greek news outlet Real News and Real FM was set on fire in Athens on Wednesday in a suspected arson attack, the media firm said. No deaths were reported, but several people with respiratory issues were taken to hospital. The news outlet linked the attack to imprisoned anarchist Yannis Michailidis.

8.title: I'm the same girl who visits temple & wears bikinis at the beach: Sara
8.article_body: Actress Sara Ali Khan opened up about how she's 'constantly evolving' in life. Speaking about herself, Sara said, "The girl going to a temple is the same girl wearing bikinis at the beach is the same girl who hates living away from her mother for 45 days while shooting." "She'll keep surprising you because she's still surprising herself," Sara added.

9.title: Russian, Ukrainian officials to discuss export of grain stocks
9.article_body: Russian and Ukrainian military officials will meet in Istanbul, Turkey on Wednesday to discuss the export of Ukrainian grain which is held up due to the ongoing war between the two countries. The United Nations organised the meeting to mitigate a potential grain shortage globally. Turkey has offered a safe route through the Black Sea to move the stocks.

10.title: 4 pilgrims from UP feared drowned in Ganga river in Uttarakhand
10.article_body: Four pilgrims from Uttar Pradesh were feared drowned after their vehicle fell into the Ganga river in Tehri district of Uttarakhand on Wednesday morning. A search operation was launched, however, the victims haven't been found yet, police said. The four were reportedly returning from Kedarnath when their car fell into the river, the relatives of one of the victims said.

11.title: Liverpool's Nunez trolled for missing open goal-scoring chance vs Man Utd
11.article_body: Liverpool's Darwin Nunez has been trolled on social media for missing an open goal-scoring opportunity against Manchester United in their pre-season game. In the 88th minute, Nunez received the ball on rebound after Mohamed Salah's effort but failed to score, kicking the ball over the bar. "Time to bring him out of my fantasy team," wrote a user on Twitter.

12.title: There isn't a single woman in Delhi who hasn't faced eve-teasing: Sanya
12.article_body: Actress Sanya Malhotra, who will reportedly feature in SRK-starrer 'Jawan', said, "I am from Delhi...but I don't feel safe there...I don't think there is a single woman in Delhi who hasn't faced eve-teasing." "I feel more safe in Mumbai," added Sanya. "I have been through so many weird situations when I was in college [in Delhi]," she had stated.

13.title: England need to think hard about pitches they want to use for next ODIs: Jaffer
13.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said England need to think hard about the pitches they want to use for the next two ODIs against India. Jaffer added that England's plan to leave grass on the wickets proved costly for hosts as "India have three quality pacers". England were dismissed for 110 runs in the first ODI on Tuesday.

14.title: Bengaluru-based startup Hyperface raises $9 mn in seed funding
14.article_body: Bengaluru-based credit-card-as-a-service platform, Hyperface has raised $9 million in a seed funding round. The round led by 3one4 Capital and Flipkart Ventures, saw participation from existing investors Better Capital and Global Founders Capital and new investors Groww and Rebalance Angel Community. It was founded by ex-banker Aishwarya Jaishankar and Ramanathan RV, former Co-founder of Juspay.

15.title: FM interested in Uranus, Pluto rather than tackling inflation: Congress
15.article_body: A day after the government released its inflation data, Congress spokesperson Gourav Vallabh on Wednesday criticised Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman for retweeting pictures from NASA's Webb Telescope. "She has an interest in Pluto, Jupiter and Uranus. Unfortunately, our Finance Minister is showing the way to Pluto, Uranus...and is unable to show...way forward to our economy," Vallabh said.

16.title: Bengaluru Police arrest two-wheeler thief; recover 25 vehicles
16.article_body: As many as 25 vehicles were recovered after Bengaluru Police arrested a notorious two-wheeler thief on Wednesday. Vinayak Patil, Deputy Commissioner of Police (North Bengaluru), shared a photo of the 25 recovered vehicles on Twitter, which include 21 motorcycles and four scooters. The vehicles were found to be registered in different states, including Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka etc.

17.title: Over 1,700 hectares burnt as wildfires rage in southwestern France
17.article_body: Around 600 firefighters supported by six water-bomber planes are battling to contain two wildfires in southwestern France, which have already burnt over 1,700 hectares of land and prompted the evacuation of thousands of tourists. "Important human and material resources are being deployed to master the fires," authorities said. France is currently suffering from a second heatwave of the year.

18.title: Succession beats West Wing, bags most Emmy acting nominations in 2022
18.article_body: The nominations for the 74th Emmy Awards were announced on Tuesday, July 12. 'Succession' received a leading 25 Emmy nominations. It also received the most acting nominations thus beating 'The West Wing', which held the previous record. 'Ted Lasso' topped the comedy and 'The White Lotus' earned the top spot in the limited series categories with 20 nominations each.

19.title: Pune's poor cut consumption of dal, meat during COVID lockdown: Study
19.article_body: As many as 194 households surveyed within Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) limits by FUSE, a transdisciplinary research project, revealed that people altered their food habits during COVID-19 lockdown. The most-affected households, which were among the low-income group, consumed less meat and dal during this period, study found. "People’s purchasing power was significantly affected," study read.

20.title: 23-yr-old garage owner runs over man with client's BMW in Delhi
20.article_body: A 23-year-old garage owner was arrested for running over a man in Delhi's Greater Kailash area with a client's BMW he had taken for repair, police said on Wednesday. DCP (south) Benita Jaiker said that during interrogation, the accused said he hit a person around 2:30 am on July 10 but could not stop the car because of high speed.

21.title: Quite scary to think where the game is headed: Ashwin on 'Bazball'
21.article_body: Talking about England's 'Bazball' approach, Ravichandran Ashwin said that as bowler, it is quite scary to think where the game is headed. "I think we need to be careful about this brand of cricket being the way forward," Ashwin added. "I definitely think the ball and the pitches have a role to play in how England are playing," he remarked.

22.title: 45 hand guns worth over ₹22 lakh seized from Indian couple at Delhi airport, pic surfaces
22.article_body: The Customs Department arrested an Indian couple that arrived from Vietnam and seized 45 hand guns worth more than ₹22 lakh from their possession. "They admitted their previous indulgence in smuggling 25 pieces of guns having a value of over ₹12 lakh," an official stated. As per reports, the couple belongs to Haryana's Gurugram.

23.title: Everyone thought I was a snob, felt like a misfit: Parambrata Chatterjee
23.article_body: Actor Parambrata Chatterjee, who featured in Vidya Balan-starrer 'Kahaani', said, "People have been...critical of me because all of them thought I was a snob since I came from a university...I felt like a misfit." "I don't know if being a son...of a famous actor...helps, but that isn't me...I feel...I should have grown up in a more regular environment," he added.

24.title: Ukraine-returned medical students protest in Odisha, say 'our futures jeopardised'
24.article_body: Ukraine-returned medical students staged a protest in Odisha's Bhubaneswar demanding admission to Indian medical universities. "All we ask is to be admitted to Indian universities, be it government or private. Our futures have been jeopardised. We cannot go back to a war-torn country," one of the protesting students said. The protestors carried placards demanding justice.

25.title: Ajoy's remark shows what Congress thinks of tribals: BJP's Babulal Marandi
25.article_body: Former CM of Jharkhand and BJP leader Babulal Marandi criticised Congress' Ajoy Kumar's "evil philosophy" remark on NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu and said that his statement shows what Congress thinks about tribals and women. "Tribal people got nothing during Congress rule," he said. Congress is having trouble because for the first time a tribal woman is nominated, he added.

26.title: AI platform Attentive raises $5 mn from Sequoia India's Surge Fund
26.article_body: Artificial Intelligence-based software-as-a-service (SaaS) platform Attentive Inc has raised $5 million from Sequoia India's Surge Fund and InfoEdge Ventures. Attentive has a SaaS-based sales automation platform for the outdoor service industry and serves the landscaping, snow removal, paving, and pest control businesses. The startup was founded by Rishabjit Singh, Sarthak Vijay, and Shiva Dhawan.

27.title: Family kidnaps 25-yr-old woman for getting married against their will in Ludhiana
27.article_body: A newlywed 25-year-old woman was allegedly kidnapped by her family from Ludhiana’s Maskeen Nagar, for getting married against their will. The woman’s husband alleged that her family members turned up at their house on Monday, thrashed him and took her with them against her will. Sub-inspector, Harpal Singh, said that an FIR has been lodged against the accused.

28.title: Do not fall ill or get into accidents: Sri Lanka doctors amid economic crisis
28.article_body: Doctors in Sri Lanka are advising people to not fall ill or get into accidents amid the country's worst economic crisis. The nation doesn't have money to pay for imports like fuel and food, and medicines for cancer, rabies and STDs are running out. Sri Lanka Medical Association President said doctors might be forced to choose which patients get treatment.

29.title: Want to keep them under wraps: Neha on why she doesn't reveal her kids' faces
29.article_body: Actress Neha Dhupia spoke about breaking her rule of hiding her kids' faces. "I am still in a phase where I want to keep them under wraps and protect them. It was just one special moment on stage, which was really important...for me," she said. "But I will go back to my notorious ways of hiding their faces," she added.

30.title: Original lion different: CPI MP demands removal of distorted emblem
30.article_body: CPI MP Binoy Viswam on Wednesday criticised the Centre and said that the original Ashoka Pillar lion differs from the one atop the new Parliament building and demanded its removal. "This lion suits the ideology and politics of RSS and BJP and PM Narendra Modi," he said. This lion is frightening everybody, he added.

31.title: 300 families in flood-hit Maha village unable to cook for 4 days
31.article_body: Around 300 families have reportedly been unable to cook their meals for the last four days after heavy rains caused flooding in Maharashtra's Kurunda village. The sarpanch of the village said that flood water has entered over 1,100 houses, damaging the food grains of the residents. A revenue official said assistance of ₹5,000 each will be given to affected people.

32.title: Gurugram court sentences man to 10 yrs in jail for firing at police
32.article_body: A local court in Gurugram has sentenced a Nuh resident to 10 years in jail for firing at a police team in 2020. The man had fired at the police team following a vehicle chase over a missing number plate. Head constable Ashok Kumar had filed an FIR at Bilaspur police station after the incident.

33.title: Will fulfil promise of making Punjab a drug-free state: AAP leader
33.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party's (AAP) Punjab unit's Chief Spokesperson Malvinder Singh Kang said the Bhagwant Mann-led government will fulfil its promise of making Punjab a drug-free state. "Earlier, only drug addicts...were arrested," he said, adding that directions have been issued to seize the property of proclaimed offenders. He further accused previous governments of "playing politics over the issue".

34.title: KCR to give positions to people who fought during T'gana movement: TRS leader
34.article_body: TRS leader K Kavitha said people who fought during Telangana movement will be awarded some position by CM K Chandrashekar Rao "when the time comes". "A very good position and identity have been given to Rajeev Sagar…Every brother, sister and people who fought during the Telangana movement with Rajeev will also be given positions by CM KCR," she added.

35.title: Difficult to manage workload, need to take care of body: Bumrah
35.article_body: India pacer Jasprit Bumrah has said "it's difficult to manage workload" across formats and that's why priority should be given to the format in which the team has to play a global event. "If it's a World Test Championship final year, the emphasis is on Test cricket," explained Bumrah. He added, "You...need to take care of your body."

36.title: Mumbai realtor cheated of ₹26 lakh, case filed against 4 persons
36.article_body: A 46-year-old realtor, Pravin Wagh, was cheated of ₹26 lakh under the pretext of facilitating a work tender of Mumbai airport's parking lot, for which the police have booked four persons. The complainant alleged that the four members cheated him after gaining his confidence. Police said a case was registered under sections of criminal breach of trust and cheating.

37.title: Fake currency notes with ₹15 lakh face value seized in Odisha, 2 held
37.article_body: Police on Wednesday said the Special Task Force (STF) seized fake currency notes with a face value of over ₹15 lakh in Odisha's Sambalpur and arrested two inter-state criminals. The STF also seized two laptops and one colour printer from the accused. Recently, the STF busted a similar racket in Bargarh district and seized notes with ₹14 lakh face value.

38.title: 52-year-old man found dead in his apartment in Thane's Mumbra
38.article_body: Police said that a 52-year-old man, Abdul Haque Zakir Ali Sayyed, was found dead in his apartment in Thane's Mumbra area. Some unidentified persons slit the victim's wrists and throat and placed the bloodstained knife in his hand to make it appear like a suicide, a police official said. The victim's son informed the police about the death.

39.title: Brought disgrace to Bihar: Tejashwi faces ridicule for fumbling before PM
39.article_body: Responding to RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav's faltering speech at an event attended by PM Narendra Modi, BJP spokesperson Arvind Kumar Singh on Wednesday said that Yadav brought disgrace to Bihar. "On the occasion of Guru Purnima, we salute the teachers of Tejashwi Yadav, who does not have enough skills to read out from a text," he said.

40.title: Mann launches new RC service, Akali Dal says it was started in 2011
40.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Tuesday announced new e-Registration Certificates (e-RCs) service for new vehicles through automobile dealers. People will get the delivery of a smart registration certificate at their doorsteps, Mann added. Shiromani Akali Dal president Sukhbir Singh Badal said that the service was started by their government in 2011 and is in place since then.

41.title: Hyderabad's infrastructure much better than Bengaluru's: T'gana IT Minister
41.article_body: Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao said that he has no competition with Bengaluru but he believes that Hyderabad's infrastructure is much better than Bengaluru's. Listing out things he tells his investors about the city, Rao said, "We tell them that Hyderabad is the city where the North meets the South. Biology marries technology...Our infrastructure is much better than Bengaluru."

42.title: Chinese scientists develop robot fish that eats microplastics
42.article_body: Chinese scientists have developed a robot fish that eats microplastics and believe it may one day help to clean up world's polluted oceans. The 1.3-cm-long black robot fish is irradiated by a light that helps it in motion and can be controlled using it. When eaten by other fish, the robot fish, made up of polyurethane, can be easily digested.

43.title: Delhi Metro ridership now 76% of pre-COVID-19 figures: DMRC MD
43.article_body: Delhi Metro has recovered around 76% of pre-COVID-19 ridership and hopes to achieve 100% ridership in the coming months, DMRC MD Vikas Kumar said. He added that the ridership has increased ever since schools and colleges reopened last week. Delhi Metro's Yellow Line has a daily ridership of 28%, while the ridership of Blue Line stands at 22%, reports said.

44.title: My surname has opened doors for me: Kamal Haasan's daughter Shruti
44.article_body: Actor Kamal Haasan's daughter and actress Shruti Haasan said she admits the fact that her surname has opened doors for her. "When I came, there was a buzz around the surname, but the truth of the matter is staying was really hard and challenging for me," added Shruti. "I was pretty much written off after my first film," she stated.

45.title: This Indian team should win all ODI, T20I World Cups: Vaughan
45.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan has said the current Indian team has the skills and should win all the global white-ball tournaments. "India have just got to get on a roll in white-ball cricket...This group of white-ball experts that have been built on the back of IPL should be pushing all the way in all conditions [across the] world," he stated.

46.title: Those 18+ to receive free booster COVID-19 dose from July 15 till next 75 days: Govt
46.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Wednesday said, "India is celebrating 75 years of Independence." "On the occasion of Azadi ka Amrit Kaal, it has been decided that from July 15 till the next 75 days, citizens above 18 years of age will be given booster COVID-19 dose free of cost," he further said.

47.title: Athiya reacts to reports of wedding with KL Rahul in 3 months, says 'Hope I'm invited'
47.article_body: After a report suggested that the wedding of actress Athiya Shetty and cricketer KL Rahul will be held in the next three months, the former responded on Instagram Stories. "I hope I'm invited to this wedding that's taking place in 3 months, lol," she wrote. Her father, actor Suniel Shetty had previously said, "No, nothing has been planned yet."

48.title: 2 Sri Lankan state broadcasters go off air as protests intensify
48.article_body: Amid anti-government protests, two Sri Lankan national TV networks, Sri Lanka Rupavahini Corporation (SLRC) and Independent Television Network (ITN Ltd), have suspended telecasts. SLRC went off air after two protesters said during a live interview on the channel that the SLRC should only telecast programmes of 'jana aragalaya' (mass struggle). Sri Lanka declared a state of emergency on Wednesday.

49.title: MP man threatens people to return money after losing election; booked
49.article_body: A man from Madhya Pradesh's Devran village has been booked for allegedly threatening people to return the money he had distributed to secure votes in the panchayat elections after his loss. A video showing the accused, Raju Dayma, asking people to return his money has reportedly surfaced online. He had allegedly recovered around ₹4 lakh from people following his defeat.

50.title: 22-year-old woman loses over ₹1 lakh to online job fraud in Pune
50.article_body: A 22-year-old woman lost over ₹1 lakh due to online job fraud in Pune, police said. An online fraudster cheated the woman on the pretext of offering her a job with a bank, police added. The accused had allegedly asked the victim to transfer the money for purposes like "registration, deposit, laptop, HR commission, GST charges" for getting the job.

51.title: Bumrah shares pic with ball after recording his best ODI figures, says 'Keeping it close'
51.article_body: Team India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah took to Instagram to share a picture of himself with the match ball after recording his best-ever ODI bowling figures. "Keeping this close," Bumrah wrote alongside the picture. The 28-year-old registered bowling figures of 7.2-3-19-6 in the first ODI against England. These are the best ODI bowling figures by an Indian outside Asia.

52.title: Won't betray Balasaheb's ideology: Eknath Shinde on Guru Purnima
52.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde paid floral tribute to Shiv Sena founder Balasaheb Thackeray on the occasion of Guru Purnima and said, "It is only due to his blessings that I stand before you all as the CM today." Sharing a Twitter post, he wrote, "Won't betray Balasaheb's ideology. That fire will not be extinguished...there is no thought without Hindutva."

53.title: US embassy in Colombo suspends consular services after SL Prez escapes
53.article_body: The US embassy in Colombo has said it was cancelling consular services for Wednesday afternoon and for Thursday as a precautionary measure. This comes after Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa fled the country on a military plane amid mass protests over the economic crisis. The Sri Lankan government has imposed a state of emergency across the country.

54.title: Was obsessed with Hrithik, screamed on seeing him at a party: Ananya
54.article_body: Talking about Hrithik Roshan, actress Ananya Panday said, "I was obsessed with Hrithik...I saw him at some birthday party and...started screaming, 'Hrithik! Hrithik!'...My parents just reacted and said, 'This is not our child'." "My mom tried to leave me and go away," Ananya had earlier shared about the incident. "I think everyone is in love with Hrithik," she had stated.

55.title: China claims it 'drove away' US warship from its waters
55.article_body: China on Wednesday said that its military had "driven away" a US warship from its territorial waters in South China Sea. The incident took place near the disputed Paracel Islands, which are also claimed by Vietnam and Taiwan. The US Navy said that the USS Benfold "asserted navigational rights and freedoms in the South China Sea...consistent with international law".

56.title: Latest rankings for ODI batters out, 1 rating point difference between Kohli, Rohit
56.article_body: The ICC today released the latest rankings for ODI batters, with fourth-ranked Rohit Sharma moving within a solitary rating point of teammate and third-placed Virat Kohli. Rohit has accumulated 802 rating points, while Kohli is on 803 rating points. Pakistan's Babar Azam remains on top of the rankings with 892 rating points, followed by his compatriot Imam-ul-Haq (815 rating points).

57.title: Prostitution racket busted in 2 spas in Bengaluru; 7 arrested, 8 rescued
57.article_body: Bengaluru's Central Crime Branch (CCB) on Monday busted a prostitution racket after women officers raided a beauty salon. The officials acted on a tip-off and raided two spas within the Puttenahalli Police Station limits, where they discovered employees involved in the prostitution racket. A total of seven people, three suspects and four customers, were arrested and eight women were rescued.

58.title: Protestors enter Sri Lanka Prime Minister's office
58.article_body: After a state of emergency was declared in Sri Lanka, protestors entered the country's Prime Minister's office. The Speaker of the country's Parliament earlier said that President Gotabaya Rajapaksa will submit his resignation today, adding that a new President will be elected on July 20. Gotabaya fled the country along with his wife.

59.title: 10-yr-old domestic help tortured to death in Pak for eating fruits
59.article_body: A 10-year-old boy working as domestic help in Pakistan's Lahore was allegedly tortured to death by his employers for eating fruits from the refrigerator without permission. The deceased's six-year-old brother, also employed in the same house, was severely injured, police said, adding that the accused "even used a knife to inflict injuries to the children". Five people have been arrested.

60.title: Minor girl's Instagram account hacked in Pune, police begin probe
60.article_body: Pimpri Chinchwad Police have registered a case of online stalking after a 15-year-old girl's Instagram account was allegedly hacked and obscene content, along with her number and photos, were added to it. An FIR was filed against an unknown person based on complaint of the girl's father. "We've launched a probe into...various digital leads available...[to track]...the suspect," police said.

61.title: I still get thin-shamed, people ask me to eat more: Erica Fernandes
61.article_body: Actress Erica Fernandes revealed she has been struggling to break away from industry norms and has been skinny-shamed by trolls for many years now. "We're living in a world where people either fat shame you, or thin shame you. We, as individuals, need to stay strong and face," she added. "I lost work because I couldn't gain weight," Erica said.

62.title: Cong must apologise: BJP on Ajoy Kumar’s ‘evil philosophy’ remark on Murmu
62.article_body: Following Congress leader Ajoy Kumar’s "evil philosophy" remark on NDA’s Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu, BJP's spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla demanded that Congress must apologise for the statement. "The Congress party must explain or else they must apologise for the statement that they have made insulting not just Droupadi Murmuji but the entire Adivasi community," he added.

63.title: India's condition will soon be like Sri Lanka, Afghanistan: TMC MP
63.article_body: India's condition will soon be like Sri Lanka and Afghanistan under the BJP-led Central government, TMC's National General Secretary and MP Abhishek Banerjee said. "The way fuel and LPG prices are rising, soon the situation will be like Sri Lanka and Afghanistan," he added. "The price hike people are facing is the prize for voting for BJP," Banerjee stated.

64.title: UP Police forms SIT to probe cases against Alt News' Mohammed Zubair
64.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police has formed a Special Investigation Team (SIT) to probe six cases registered against Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair in Sitapur, Lakhimpur Kheri, Hathras, Ghaziabad and Muzaffarnagar. Zubair was remanded to 14-day judicial custody by a Lakhimpur Kheri court in UP on Monday. A police complaint was filed alleging Zubair circulated false news to disturb communal harmony.

65.title: Indians will create Sri Lanka, Afghanistan-like situation against BJP: TMC MP
65.article_body: TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee said BJP will face Sri Lanka and Afghanistan-like situation by people because of the hike in fuel prices in country. "People won’t have food to survive. What happened in Sri Lanka and Afghanistan, people of India will create similar situation against BJP I believe," Banerjee added. Petrol and diesel prices are rising steadily, he stated.

66.title: India's Suryakumar Yadav jumps 44 spots in latest rankings for T20I batters
66.article_body: Team India batter Suryakumar Yadav, who slammed his maiden hundred in T20I cricket against England on July 10, has jumped 44 spots to reach the fifth spot in the latest rankings for T20I batters. Suryakumar has accumulated 732 rating points, which is his career-best rating so far. Suryakumar is the only Indian batter in top 10.

67.title: IMDb releases list of top 10 Indian films in 2022 so far
67.article_body: IMDb on Wednesday released the list of most popular Indian films of 2022 so far. The top 10 films so far, in order of their IMDb rating, are- 'Vikram' (8.6), 'KGF: Chapter 2' (8.5), 'The Kashmir Files' (8.3), 'Hridayam' (8.1), 'RRR' (8.0), 'A Thursday' (7.8), 'Jhund' (7.4), 'Runway 34' (7.1), 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' (7.0) and 'Samrat Prithviraj' (7.0).

68.title: England thought short ball was Rohit's weakness, his counter was fantastic: Kaif
68.article_body: Praising him for his unbeaten 76-run innings in the first ODI against England, Mohammad Kaif said the Team India captain Rohit Sharma's counterattack against short balls was "fantastic". "Rohit got dismissed [against short balls] in between quite a few times and England thought it's his weakness," added Kaif. Rohit's five sixes in the first ODI came against the short balls.

69.title: U'khand bans swords, tridents & other harmful objects in Kanwar Yatra
69.article_body: Uttarakhand administration has barred pilgrims from carrying swords, tridents and other harmful objects during the Kanwar Yatra, scheduled to begin tomorrow. "There will be a ban on bringing swords, tridents and sticks in the Kanwar Yatra," a police official said. "All the station and outpost in-charges have been instructed to seize them at the district borders," he added.

70.title: Writer Khaled Hosseini's daughter comes out as transgender, he pens note for her
70.article_body: 'The Kite Runner' writer Khaled Hosseini's 21-year-old daughter Haris has come out as transgender. He shared her pictures and wrote, "I've known about Haris' journey since last year...I've never been prouder of her." He added, "I know this process was painful for her...She is sober to the cruelty trans people are subjected to daily. But she is strong and undaunted."

71.title: Bumrah becomes world number one ODI bowler after career-best performance
71.article_body: India pacer Jasprit Bumrah has become the world number one ODI bowler in the latest rankings released by ICC. The 28-year-old, who recorded his best bowling figures in ODIs by taking six wickets for 19 runs against England on Tuesday, jumped five places to reach the top spot. New Zealand fast bowler Trent Boult has dropped to the second position.

72.title: Scindia's new bungalow in Bhopal flooded with drain water amid rain, video surfaces
72.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia's new government bungalow in Bhopal's Shymala Hills getting flooded with drain water amid continuous rain. In the video, a worker can be seen draining out the water using a wiper. Scindia had shifted to the bungalow in May this year after its renovation.

73.title: Owner of car with 'Papa' number plate in Uttarakhand fined; police shares pic
73.article_body: The owner of a car has been fined by the Uttarakhand Police over its number plate that read "Papa". Police shared before and after pictures of the number plate on Twitter and said that it received the complaint through a tweet. Twitter users praised the police for its action against the car owner.

74.title: 20-yr-old Mumbai student on picnic in Lonavala drowns in waterfall
74.article_body: A 20-year-old BCom student from Mumbai reportedly drowned in a waterfall near Bhushi dam on Monday. The deceased, Sahil Saroj, had come for a picnic in Lonavala with a group of 250 students. "Sahil and his friend went to the...waterfall...He waded into the gushing waters...and failed to come out. He fell from the cliff from where waterfall starts," police said.

75.title: Maha CM asks officials to keep emergency services on alert amid rains
75.article_body: Speaking about the monsoon rains situation in Maharashtra, newly appointed Chief Minister Eknath Shinde said that he has directed the district officials to keep emergency services on alert. He also asked the officials to ensure that no untoward incident occurs and assistance reaches the affected people on time. Several districts of Maharashtra are on red and orange alert.

76.title: Bumrah's wife Sanjana trolls England batters by visiting 'Crispy Duck' stall
76.article_body: India pacer Jasprit Bumrah's wife Sanjana Ganesan visited a stall called 'Crispy Duck' at The Oval to troll England after four of their batters got out for ducks in the first ODI. She said, "We've come to...stall that not a lot of English batters would like to come to...We want to see how good the duck is off the field."

77.title: I really don't know: Bumrah on status of Kohli's groin strain
77.article_body: Team India pacer Jasprit Bumrah, on being asked about the status of Virat Kohli's injury after the first ODI against England, said he doesn't know the status of the injury. "Because I didn't play the last game (3rd T20I). Hopefully, he recovers, but I really don't know," stated Bumrah. Kohli missed the first ODI due to a "mild groin strain".

78.title: Nobody's done what we're doing with ancient Indian inspiration: Ayan
78.article_body: Filmmaker Ayan Mukerji, who's directed the upcoming film 'Brahmastra', said, "No one's...done what we are doing with ancient Indian inspiration in the modern world ever." Talking about the character of Ranbir Kapoor, Ayan stated, "He's a miracle because he's an astra himself - Agni astra...He is named after the God who is the...all powerful and my greatest inspiration, Shiva."

79.title: Dengue cases surge in West Bengal, highest in last 4 yrs
79.article_body: Dengue cases are rising in West Bengal as the state recorded a four-year high in first 26 weeks of this year. While the state registered 1,037 dengue cases in first 26 weeks of 2019, that number dropped to 619 and 273 in 2020 and 2021, respectively. However, it has shot up to 1,751 in first 26 weeks of 2022.

80.title: 21-yr-old woman jumps off moving SUV to escape molestation bid in Lucknow
80.article_body: A 21-year-old woman reportedly jumped off a moving SUV to escape a molestation bid in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow. She was rushed to a hospital after sustaining injuries in the incident. "The accused had offered a lift to the girl...After driving some distance, he started making advances towards her and...tried to molest her," police said. He was arrested on Tuesday.

81.title: 5 killed in 24 hours in Maharashtra amid heavy rains; death toll rises to 89
81.article_body: At least five persons were killed in 24 hours amid heavy rains and flood-like situations across various districts in Maharashtra. The total death toll has risen to 89. One person died in Raigad due to the collapse of a structure and another died in Palghar in a landslide. Notably, three persons lost their lives in Nagpur due to flash floods.

82.title: Woman's body found near posh residential complex in Greater Noida
82.article_body: The body of an unidentified woman was found near a posh residential apartment complex in Greater Noida on Tuesday, police said. "The woman is around 35 years old and we are trying to identify her," police added. "There is a deep cut on her left wrist due to which she seems to have lost a lot of blood," police stated.

83.title: Raj govt to study recruitment exam models of Tamil Nadu, Kerala: Gehlot
83.article_body: The Rajasthan government will study recruitment examination models of Tamil Nadu and Kerala for the smooth conduct of such exams in the state, CM Ashok Gehlot said on Tuesday. A high-level team will visit both states to get detailed information, he added. Notably, the Rajasthan Police Constable recruitment exam was cancelled in May following a paper leak.

84.title: You get such wickets very rarely: Shami on The Oval ODI vs England
84.article_body: India pacer Mohammad Shami said pacers are always longing to bowl on wickets like the one they got in the first ODI against England at The Oval on Tuesday. "You get such wickets very rarely...it is a different feeling that the ball is going to do something now," he added. Shami picked three wickets, conceding 31 runs in the match.

85.title: Sri Lanka Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe appointed acting President
85.article_body: Sri Lanka Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe has been appointed as the acting President of the country. This comes after President Gotabaya Rajapaksa fled Sri Lanka on a military jet amid mass protests over the economic crisis. The country's air force confirmed the 73-year-old flew to the Maldives with his wife and two security officials.

86.title: SC refuses to pass interim order staying demolitions across states
86.article_body: Supreme Court refused to pass an interim order staying demolitions across states. It cannot pass an omnibus order preventing authorities from taking action, the court added. "Rule of law has to be followed...But can we pass an omnibus order?" SC stated. It was hearing pleas over demolitions of properties of alleged accused in cases of violence in various states.

87.title: Congress has to do a lot of introspection: Digambar Kamat
87.article_body: Former Goa CM Digambar Kamat said Congress has to do a lot of introspection as the party is losing so many polls and leaders are leaving. "I worked for the party with sincerity," Kamat added. His statement came after Congress accused Michael Lobo and Kamat of "conspiring and hobnobbing" with BJP to engineer a split in the party’s legislative wing.

88.title: 80% ready to pay premium for environmentally-safe products: Public poll
88.article_body: 83% of the 1.76 lakh people surveyed across India said that they support the ban on single-use plastic, according to a poll conducted on Public, India's largest location-based social network. Although 62.8% believe the ban might cause some inconvenience to their day-to-day lives, about 80% said they are willing to switch to expensive, environmentally safe products to protect the environment.

89.title: Chris didn't eat meat before kiss in 'Thor: Love...' as I'm vegan: Natalie
89.article_body: Talking about her kissing scene with Chris Hemsworth in the film 'Thor: Love and Thunder', actress Natalie Portman said, "The day we had a kiss scene he didn't eat meat that morning because I'm vegan." "He eats meat like every half [an] hour," added Natalie. "I didn't even know Chris could go without eating meat," stated their co-star Tessa Thompson.

90.title: Bengaluru's St Joseph's College upgraded to a university
90.article_body: St Joseph's College (Autonomous) in Karnataka's Bengaluru has been upgraded to St Joseph's University, the university's management announced on Tuesday. The university is expected to be fully operational for academic year 2022-23. Notably, the process to confer the university status began in 2013 when the Ministry of Education launched the Rashtriya Uchchatar Shiksha Abhiyan (RUSA) scheme.

91.title: Rupee hits new lifetime low of 79.67 per US dollar
91.article_body: The Indian rupee hit a new record low of 79.67 for a third straight session on Wednesday. In the previous session, the rupee had collapsed to close at 79.60 against the dollar. "There is a general risk-off sentiment. Until flows come back, we will see the dollar being bid against currencies like ours," a senior trader told Reuters.

92.title: We recreated Partition so beautifully, it really moves: 'Ms...' actor
92.article_body: Discussing the Partition in 1947 being recreated in 'Ms Marvel', the show's actor Mohan Kapur said, "The scenes are shot so beautifully and it really moves. Wow!" "I don’t know how many people...know about (the Partition)...That was our genocide," added Mohan. 'Ms Marvel' director Sharmeen Obaid-Chinoy had earlier said there were close to 1,000 extras on set in the scene.

93.title: DRI detects customs duty evasion of ₹4,389 crore by Oppo India
93.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) has detected customs duty evasion of nearly ₹4,389 crore by Oppo India. Searches were conducted by DRI at office of Oppo India and residences of its key management employees. This led to the recovery of incriminating evidence indicating wilful mis-declaration in the description of certain items imported by Oppo India.

94.title: I know what it feels like, it's not nice: Morgan on England's 10-wicket loss
94.article_body: Reacting to England's 10-wicket defeat in the first ODI against India, ex-England captain Eoin Morgan said Jos Buttler, the current English skipper, will have to take this as an opportunity to "reiterate a strong message about where they are going and what they're doing". Morgan added, "I know what this feels like. It's not nice...but [this] is time to lead."

95.title: Delhi HC allows Vivo to operate bank accounts if it furnishes bank guarantee of ₹950 cr
95.article_body: The Delhi High Court has allowed Chinese smartphone manufacturer Vivo to operate its bank accounts if it furnishes a bank guarantee of ₹950 crore. The court has also directed Vivo to maintain ₹250 crore in its accounts. Vivo India on Friday approached the court challenging the freezing of its bank accounts by ED in connection with a money laundering case.

96.title: Man attacks policemen with shaving blade in Delhi's Dwarka; arrested
96.article_body: A 39-year-old man was arrested for attacking two policemen with a shaving blade in Delhi's Dwarka area on Tuesday. The accused was chasing another person with the blade to allegedly attack him. When the policemen caught him, the accused reportedly assaulted them. One of them suffered injuries on his head while the other suffered injuries on his hand, police said.

97.title: Droupadi Murmu represents very evil philosophy of India: Congress leader
97.article_body: Congress leader Ajoy Kumar said NDA’s Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu represents a "very evil philosophy of India" and should not be made a "symbol of Adivasi". Following Kumar’s statement, BJP’s spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla said that Congress has insulted Murmu. "Yashwant Sinha is also a good candidate," Kumar added. "[PM] Modi-led government is fooling people," he stated.

98.title: Muslims using most contraceptives: Owaisi on UP CM’s 'population imbalance' remark
98.article_body: Following UP CM Yogi Adityanath’s "population imbalance" remark, AIMIM’s Asaduddin Owaisi said that Muslims are the ones using most contraceptives. "The total fertility rate which was 2.6 in 2016 is now 2.3. The country’s demographic dividend is the best among all countries," Owaisi added. "Their own Health Minister said no law is needed in country for population control," Owaisi stated.

99.title: Water level of Navi Mumbai's Ransai Dam reaches 112 ft, to overflow anytime
99.article_body: The water level of Ransai Dam located in Navi Mumbai's Uran area has reached 112.5 feet after continuous heavy rainfall in Maharashtra. As per report, the water level in the dam can anytime cross its maximum level of 116.5 feet and it will start overflowing. The Ransai Dam supplies water to more than one lakh people in 37 gram panchayats.

100.title: Central schemes have become scams in West Bengal: Smriti Irani
100.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Tuesday said that the central schemes have become "scams" in West Bengal. "People have asked me to inform the administration to get them the central schemes as they are deprived of it," Irani added. She further said that she has spoken with the district administration and informed them about the "distress" of the people.

101.title: BMC staffer arrested in Mumbai for unnatural sex with man, causing him burns
101.article_body: A BMC employee was arrested for reportedly having unnatural sex with a 33-year-old man in Mumbai. The complainant said the accused was upset as he had demanded ₹6,000 from him. On July 6, after paying the money, the accused allegedly beat up the complainant and had unnatural sex with him, causing burn injuries to his private parts.

102.title: Which Indian places have been featured in TIME's 'The World's Greatest Places of 2022'?
102.article_body: TIME magazine has published a list of 'The World's Greatest Places of 2022' featuring "50 extraordinary destinations to explore" which includes India's Kerala and Ahmedabad. Calling Kerala the ecotourism hot spot, TIME said it is one of India's most beautiful states. The magazine said India's first UNESCO World Heritage City Ahmedabad is a mecca for cultural tourism and higher learning.

103.title: Pic of Elon Musk's business card from 1995 goes viral
103.article_body: A picture of Tesla CEO Elon Musk's business card from 1995 has gone viral on social media. The picture was shared by a Twitter handle named DogeDesigner. Responding to the picture of the card, which described Musk as Chairman of the Board, Chief Technology Officer and Co-founder of Zip2, Musk tweeted, "Ancient times."

104.title: COVID cases may increase five-fold: S Korea as cases hit 2-month high
104.article_body: Daily COVID-19 infections in South Korea on Wednesday jumped above 40,000 for the first time in two months, with the government warning of a potential five-fold surge in infections. Wednesday's figure of 40,266 represents an 8% jump over the previous day. "Daily infections could soar to...2,00,000 between mid-August and late September," PM Han Duck-soo told a government COVID-19 response meeting.

105.title: Wish to buy my films, watch myself as I'm very scared of judgement: Ranbir
105.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor said he wishes to buy all his films and watch them himself as he is "very scared" of judgement. "My last film 'Sanju', which came out four years ago, was a big hit. But still, people are saying that 'Shamshera' is my comeback film," added Ranbir. "So I do not understand what is this comeback film," he stated.

106.title: South films are remade in Hindi with cynical attitude: Producer Siddharth
106.article_body: Producer Siddharth Roy Kapur, who produced Aamir Khan-starrer 'Dangal', said, "South films are often remade in Hindi with a 'cynical attitude' because they worked in the past." "Unless the filmmakers...share the conviction of their South counterparts, they will not work," added Siddharth. "There has been no concentrated and strategic effort [by Bollywood] to cross state boundaries," he stated.

107.title: CNG, PNG prices hiked by ₹4 and ₹3 in Mumbai; 4th hike in 2022
107.article_body: Mahanagar Gas Limited has increased the prices of Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) and Piped Natural Gas (PNG) prices in and around Mumbai by ₹4 and ₹3 respectively. CNG will now cost ₹80 per kilogram whereas PNG will cost ₹48.50 per Standard Cubic Metre (SCM). Notably, this is the fourth hike in the prices of natural gas in 2022.

108.title: Safari Park at Hyderabad's Nehru Zoo flooded amid heavy rainfall
108.article_body: The Safari Park at Hyderabad's Nehru Zoological Park was flooded after heavy rainfall caused water in the Mir Alam Tank to overflow and enter the premises, Zoo officials said on Tuesday. Following the inundation, authorities declared the Safari Park closed to the public. However, the remainder of the Zoo will remain available to visitors from 8.30 am to 4.30 pm.

109.title: Sri Lanka declares state of emergency after President escapes to Maldives
109.article_body: Sri Lanka has declared a state of emergency after President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's escape to Maldives, the Prime Minister's office said. Thousands of protesters took to the streets of Sri Lanka's capital Colombo, demanding Rajapaksa's immediate resignation. Police fired tear gas to scatter protesters near Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe's office.

110.title: 4 killed as under-construction railway underpass collapses in J'khand
110.article_body: Four workers died after an under-construction railway underpass collapsed in Jharkhand's Dhanbad district on Tuesday night. According to officials, the labourers were working at the underpass between Pradhankanta and Sindri rail section. The portion caved in after a goods train crossed from a nearby track following which Railway and administrative officials rushed to the spot, officials added.

111.title: Dozens dead, thousands trapped without food as gangs battle in Haiti
111.article_body: Gun battles between rival gangs in the Haitian town of Cite Soleil have left thousands trapped without access to water, food or medical care, international aid group Doctors Without Borders said. Dozens of people have reportedly died in four days of gang battles. Cite Soleil, which lies on the outskirts of Haiti's capital Port-au-Prince, has a population of around 2,50,000.

112.title: Rhea, Sushant's flatmate Siddharth abetted the actor's extreme drug addiction: NCB
112.article_body: The NCB in its draft charge against 35 accused booked in the alleged drugs case filed after Sushant Singh Rajput's death said they entered a criminal conspiracy for distribution of drugs in Bollywood. Drugs were procured for Sushant by his flatmate Siddharth Pithani, Rhea Chakraborty and others who "aided and abetted" the actor to "extreme drug addiction", it added.

113.title: Genetically engineered pig hearts successfully transplanted into 2 dead people in US
113.article_body: A team at NYU Langone Health successfully transplanted two genetically engineered pig hearts into recently deceased humans with an aim to provide an alternative supply of organs for people with life-threatening heart disease amid shortages. The surgeries were performed over several hours and heart function was monitored for three days. No signs of early rejection were observed in either organ.

114.title: India is mother of all democracies: PM Modi in Bihar
114.article_body: Addressing an event in Bihar, PM Narendra Modi said that India is not just the largest democracy but it is also the "mother of all democracies". The PM also stated that the nation was "on its way to becoming a mature democracy" which was evident from "better attendance of lawmakers inside Parliament and state assemblies" and "discarding of obsolete laws".

115.title: 1 dead, 2 seriously injured in landslide in Vasai in Maharashtra's Palghar
115.article_body: At least one person died and two others were seriously injured in a landslide incident in the Vasai area of Maharashtra's Palghar district amid heavy rains, the District Collector said. At least two persons have been rescued so far and three are still feared trapped. Local firemen rescued a woman and her daughter from their house, officials said.

116.title: If Kohli doesn't play the next game, then it would be more than a niggle: Ojha
116.article_body: Ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha has said if Virat Kohli doesn't play in the second ODI against England, then his injury could be more than a "mild groin strain". He stated that Kohli should be fit if he's suffering from a niggle. However, according to a report, Kohli is yet to recover and is unlikely to play in the second ODI.

117.title: We support tribals: Aaditya Thackeray on Shiv Sena supporting Murmu
117.article_body: Soon after ex-Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray announced that Shiv Sena will support Droupadi Murmu for Presidential polls, Aaditya Thackeray said his party has decided to do so as Murmu is a tribal woman. "Today we've different political views but Droupadi Murmu is a tribal woman and we support tribals. That's why we will vote in favour of Murmu," he added.

118.title: LGBTQ members allege harassment by police at Pune event
118.article_body: The organisers of a private LGBTQ event held in Pune on July 9 have complained of harassment by the police. Writing to the Police Commissioner, they alleged that police locked around 150 members of their community inside the event venue without a warrant. "They...proceeded to use homophobic and derogatory statements," the founder of Mist LGBTQ Foundation told The Indian Express.

119.title: Rishi Kapoor & I argued, fought with each other: Karan on Agneepath
119.article_body: Karan Malhotra, the director of Hrithik Roshan-starrer 'Agneepath' which also featured late actor Rishi Kapoor, said, "[Rishi and I] would argue [and] fight...[over] the character arc." Karan added that they threw challenges at each other. "[Rishi] was...very flamboyant, loud...and...confrontational," he had earlier stated. Karan has directed Ranbir Kapoor-starrer 'Shamshera'.

120.title: 5 held in UP's Prayagraj for anti-Modi poster, T'gana man likely involved
120.article_body: The Prayagraj Police arrested five people in connection with an anti-Modi poster that was put up in the city. The police named a man hailing from Telangana as the prime accused in the matter. The accused have been booked under IPC Section 153B (hurting religious sentiments) and Section 505 (2) (statements creating and promoting enmity, hatred, or ill-will between classes).

121.title: 9 years on, the bond is still strong with Rohit Sharma: Shikhar Dhawan
121.article_body: After India openers Shikhar Dhawan and Rohit Sharma remained unbeaten to chase down England's 111-run target in their first ODI on Tuesday, Dhawan tweeted a picture of him and Rohit and wrote, "Nine years on, the bond is still strong Rohit." In the match, the duo became the fourth opening pair in ODI cricket to complete 5,000 runs in partnership.

122.title: Bradley Cooper is dating Hillary Clinton's former top aide Huma Abedin: Report
122.article_body: Bradley Cooper is dating Huma Abedin, the former top aide to Hillary Clinton and former wife of politician Anthony Weiner, according to Page Six. They were reportedly introduced by Vogue editor Anna Wintour, who is close to both Cooper and Abedin. The couple arrived together at the Met Gala event, however, they parted ways for the red carpet, reports claimed.

123.title: US First Lady apologises after saying Latinos unique as 'breakfast tacos'
123.article_body: US First Lady Jill Biden has apologised for saying Latinos are as unique as "breakfast tacos". "The First Lady apologises that her words conveyed anything but pure admiration and love for...Latino community," her spokesperson said. Condemning Biden's comments, National Association of Hispanic Journalists had said, "We're not tacos. Our heritage as Latinos...shouldn't be reduced to a stereotype."

124.title: Anand Mahindra shares edited pic showing 'future of UK PM's residence'; it goes viral
124.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to share an edited picture showing the "future of UK PM's residence". "The future of 10 Downing Street? The famed British humour is now laced with Desi humour," Mahindra wrote. Mahindra shared the picture as Rishi Sunak, who has Indian roots, is one of the contenders for UK Prime Minister's post.

125.title: 47-yr-old woman found dead in lodge in Mumbai, boyfriend absconding
125.article_body: A 47-year-old woman was found dead in a lodge near Aksa Beach in Mumbai's Malad on Tuesday evening, an official said. The man, reportedly her boyfriend, is absconding, he added. The two had checked into the lodge on Monday night and began fighting soon after, he further said. "On Tuesday morning, the man left the place," the official stated.

126.title: TMC insulted Goddess Kali, now disrespecting National Emblem: Irani
126.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Tuesday reacted to TMC's criticism of the National Emblem atop the new Parliament building. "It is not unexpected from the party and its leaders who insult Goddess Kali to insult the National Emblem," Irani said. "Those leaders who...either disregarded or discarded the Constitution over the years, are expected to oppose the National Emblem," she added.

127.title: Religious conversion leads to separatism: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat
127.article_body: Religious conversion should not be done as it separates individuals from their roots, RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said on Tuesday. "Religious conversion leads to separatism. Conversion separates one from the roots. Hence, we should strive to stop religious conversion," Bhagwat added. "We have to ensure that 'dharma' should pervade all over," he stated.

128.title: Mistaking it for road, man drives into overflowing lake in Thane; rescued
128.article_body: Locals rescued a cab driver in Thane after he reportedly drove into the overflowing Phadke Pada lake. The water from the lake was flowing on the road, making it invisible to motorists. "I was new to the area...I could see farmland on the right...there was only water on the left...I was unaware that there was a lake there," driver said.

129.title: Mumbai civic body to start doorstep checks for hypertension, diabetes
129.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation has started to train over 3,000 Community Health Volunteers (CHVs), who will be conducting door-to-door screening for diabetes and hypertension across Mumbai. CHVs will identify suspects and direct them to nearest dispensary for confirmatory test. The civic body took the step after it learnt that cases related to non-communicable diseases are on the rise.

130.title: Rhea received drugs and handed them over to Sushant Singh Rajput: Draft charges
130.article_body: According to draft charges submitted against Rhea Chakraborty in a Special NDPS court, the actress received deliveries of drugs from Samuel Miranda, Showik Chakraborty, Dipesh Sawant and others, and handed over those deliveries to late actor Sushant Singh Rajput. The draft also states that delivery of drugs for the actor had been taking place since 2018.

131.title: National flag, Coast Guard flags found lying in garbage in Kerala; case filed
131.article_body: A case has been registered after the National flag and the Coast Guard flags were found lying in the garbage in Kochi's Irumpanam region on Tuesday. Besides flags, life jackets and raincoats of the Coast Guard were also found dumped by locals. According to police, the items might have been handed over to be disposed of by the Coast Guard.

132.title: Indian School of Business opens admissions for full-time PGP programme
132.article_body: The Indian School of Business has announced that it is now accepting admission applications for its Post Graduate Programme in Management (PGP). The one-year full-time programme has been ranked no. 1 in India and fourth in Asia by FT World MBA Rankings 2022. The programme endows young managers with multidisciplinary perspectives and global exposure, ISB stated.

133.title: Shiv Sena spokesperson Sheetal Mhatre joins Eknath Shinde camp
133.article_body: Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena party spokesperson and former Mumbai corporator Sheetal Mhatre on Tuesday joined the Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde-led Sena camp. Mhatre, along with some Sena workers, visited Shinde's residence on Tuesday night and expressed their support for him. She had represented ward number 7 in suburban Dahisar in north Mumbai in 2012 and 2017.

134.title: Sena part of MVA but didn’t consult us: Cong leader on Shiv Sena's support to Murmu
134.article_body: Congress leader Balasaheb Thorat said Shiv Sena didn't consult his party before deciding to support Droupadi Murmu for Presidential polls. "Though Shiv Sena is part of MVA, it didn't consult us about this," he said. Everyone who supports the "Constitution and democracy" is supporting the Opposition's candidate for Presidential polls, Yashwant Sinha, for the post, Thorat added.

135.title: 20-year-old dies of electrocution at Sinhagad road in Pune
135.article_body: A 20-year-old youth was electrocuted after coming in contact with a live wire near Sawai hotel on Pune's Sinhagad road. The electricity company, MSEDCL, said that a broken cable without electricity was hanging on the footpath. "To remove the wire, [the deceased] pulled it. The...cable came in contact with high tension live cable resulting in his death," MSEDCL said.

136.title: In pics: First images of unseen Universe captured by NASA's Webb Telescope
136.article_body: NASA has revealed James Webb Space Telescope's first full-colour images of the unseen Universe. These images include Carina Nebula - the landscape of 'mountains' and 'valleys' speckled with glittering stars, Stephan's Quintet - a grouping of five galaxies showing huge shockwaves and tidal tails, and Southern Ring Nebula which shows a dying star cloaked by dust and layers of light.

137.title: India reports 16,906 COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, 24% higher than yesterday
137.article_body: India has reported 16,906 COVID-19 cases, 15,447 recoveries and 45 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 13,615 cases and 20 deaths. Notably, India's active COVID-19 cases jumped to 1,32,457, while the death toll reached 5,25,519.

138.title: DMRC junks MetroLite plan for Red Line extension
138.article_body: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) has dropped the plan to run MetroLite, sleeker, tram-like trains, for Red Line extension. MetroLite was initially planned for the area as they were projected to have a limited ridership, but it has been revised due to Delhi government's plans to create a transit-oriented hub in Narela, DMRC MD Vikas Kumar said.

139.title: India responds after reports claim India helped Sri Lanka President escape
139.article_body: After reports claimed that India helped Sri Lanka President Gotabaya Rajapaksa escape, High Commission of India in Colombo said, "High Commission categorically denies baseless and speculative media reports." "It's reiterated that India will continue to support people of Sri Lanka as they seek to realize their aspirations for prosperity and progress through democratic means and values," it added.

140.title: Exciting to get seam and swing in white-ball cricket: Bumrah on 6/19 vs Eng
140.article_body: Talking about his career-best figures of 6/19 in the first ODI against England, Jasprit Bumrah said it was exciting to get swing and seam movement in a white-ball match. "When I bowled the first ball, I found some swing and we tried to exploit that...When the wicket is flat your accuracy is tested," he added. Shami registered figures of 3/31.

141.title: People didn't have any expectations from me: Actress Taapsee Pannu
141.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu, who will feature in Shah Rukh Khan-starrer ‘Dunki’, said people never expected anything from her as an actress. "It is good to have [such] people,” added Taapsee. “I had three-four flops in South and...started getting tagged as the bad luck charm and someone who shouldn’t be cast in movies because she’s just jinxing,” she had earlier stated.

142.title: Want to con SS Rajamouli into making a film starring only me: Ranbir
142.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor has jokingly said he wants to "con" filmmaker SS Rajamouli into making a film starring only him which will be shot on an island. "I [also want to] kiss Lionel Messi's left foot," added Ranbir. Rajamouli earlier termed Ranbir as his favourite actor in Bollywood. "You can feel the [performance's] intensity...through his eyes and subtle expressions," he'd said.

143.title: We came 3rd in two-horse race: Buttler on 10-wicket defeat in 1st India ODI
143.article_body: England white-ball captain Jos Buttler said they "came third in a two-horse race" after losing the first ODI against India by 10 wickets on Tuesday. He added, "It's tough to take but we've got to dust ourselves down quickly for [the next] game." Buttler further said they knew the ball might swing in "muggy conditions" but India "exploited conditions fantastically".

144.title: Population explosion not a problem of any religion but entire country: Naqvi
144.article_body: BJP leader Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi has said that "population explosion" is not a problem of any religion but an issue for the entire country. It is not right to associate it with caste and religion, Naqvi added. "Some people want to create unlimited problems on the pretext of Allah’s mercy," Naqvi stated.

145.title: Don't allow swearing-in of ministers till SC's verdict: Sena to Maha Guv
145.article_body: Shiv Sena wrote to Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari stating that since a petition seeking the disqualification of 16 legislators was pending in Supreme Court (SC), he should not allow the swearing-in of any minister until the court's decision. "Rewarding persons against whom disqualification proceedings are pending...would be destructive of the Constitutional scheme," the letter added.

146.title: 32 fish kill incidents recorded across B'luru lakes in last 5 yrs: Report
146.article_body: About 32 fish kill incidents were reported across Bengaluru lakes in the last five years, said a report by non-profit organisation ActionAid Association. Of these, eight incidents took place in the last seven months, it added. Based on the number of fish deaths, the report further identified Madiwala, Haralur, Bellandur and Kommaghatta lakes as most vulnerable to fish kill incidents.

147.title: 6 die in 24 hours amid heavy rains in Gujarat; death toll rises to 69
147.article_body: As many as six people died in rain-related incidents amid heavy rains in Gujarat in the last 24 hours, state Disaster Management Minister Rajendra Trivedi said. The death toll in rain-related incidents in the state since June 1 has risen to 69, he added. A 50-year-old man died after being swept off by floodwaters in Rajkot.

148.title: Pune receives 165.7 mm rainfall; Khadakwasla dam overflows
148.article_body: Pune on Tuesday received 165.7 mm of rainfall which is 26% less than normal. Khadakwasla dam overflowed and its water capacity reached 95% on Tuesday. With the prediction of more rains in the next few days, 905 cusecs water was released from new Mutha right canal and 11,900 cusecs was released from the spillway of the dam into Mutha river.

149.title: 'Oh the irony lol' tweets Elon Musk after Twitter sues him
149.article_body: Minutes after news surfaced that Twitter has sued him for breaching the $44 billion contract, Tesla CEO Elon Musk took to the microblogging site and tweeted, "Oh the irony lol". As per The Verge, the lawsuit was filed in Delaware's Court of Chancery, accusing Musk of hypocrisy. Twitter is represented by M&A law firm Wachtell, Lipton, Rosen & Katz.

150.title: Rohit breaks Afridi's world record, becomes fastest batter to reach 250 ODI sixes
150.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma on Tuesday broke former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi's world record for being the fastest batter to reach 250 sixes in ODI cricket. Rohit took 224 innings to reach 250 sixes. Afridi had taken 259 innings to reach the milestone. Rohit slammed five sixes against England on Tuesday to complete 250 sixes in ODI cricket.

151.title: Water level in Hyderabad's Hussain Sagar lake crosses full tank level
151.article_body: Following heavy rains across Telangana, the water level in Hyderabad's Hussain Sagar lake crossed the full tank level on Tuesday. The water level was recorded at 513.44 metres against the full tank level of 513.41 metres. According to civic officials, there is no danger from Hussain Sagar, but residents living in downstream areas might be affected if the rain continues.

152.title: Sri Lankan President escapes to Maldives with his wife amid economic crisis
152.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa fled the country for the Maldives on Wednesday, hours before he was due to resign amid the economic crisis. Rajapaksa, his wife and two bodyguards left aboard a Sri Lankan Air Force plane, an immigration official told Reuters. Rajapaksa would most likely proceed to another Asian country from there, a government source said.

153.title: Shami creates history, becomes fastest Indian bowler to reach 150 wickets in ODI cricket
153.article_body: Fast bowler Mohammad Shami on Tuesday created history by becoming the fastest Indian bowler to reach 150 ODI wickets. With his three wickets in the first ODI against England, Shami took his tally of wickets in ODI cricket to 151 in 80 matches. Ajit Agarkar was the previous fastest Indian bowler to reach 150 ODI wickets, taking 97 matches.

154.title: India overtake Pakistan in latest ODI team rankings
154.article_body: India have overtaken Pakistan in the latest ICC ODI team rankings after their 10-wicket victory in the first ODI of their three-match series against England on Tuesday. India moved to the third position in the rankings with 108 rating points, leaving Pakistan behind at the fourth position with 106 points. Before the match, India were placed fourth with 105 points.

155.title: Rohit Sharma's 79-metre six hits girl in the stands, video surfaces
155.article_body: During the fifth over of India's innings against England in the first ODI, Rohit Sharma's 79-metre six went on to hit a girl in the stands. It resulted in play being halted for a short while. A video surfaced online showing a man consoling the girl. England's physio and team doctor were seen rushing towards the girl.

156.title: DMRC plans to start 3-car metro train service for 1st time in Delhi
156.article_body: Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC), for the first time, has planned to start a three-car metro train service from Narela to the Rithala section. "DMRC will have a proper metro but initially it will construct three-coach train platforms and later extend the facility to run six-coach trains in future," DMRC chief Vikas Kumar said. "These are currently proposals," he added.

157.title: Twitter sues Elon Musk for backing out of $44 billion deal
157.article_body: Twitter has sued Elon Musk for violating his $44 billion deal to buy the social media platform. "Musk apparently believes that he...is free to change his mind, trash the company...and walk away," said the lawsuit. Musk said he was terminating the deal because Twitter violated the agreement by failing to respond to requests for information regarding fake or spam accounts.

158.title: Delhi Metro to launch e-auto service for last mile connectivity
158.article_body: The Delhi Metro will soon launch its first e-auto service to boost last-mile connectivity for commuters, officials said. A batch of 50 e-vehicles will be launched from Dwarka Sector-9 station and a total of 136 autos will be present in the sub-city, DMRC chief Vikas Kumar said. Charging points and other arrangements are being made at the station.

159.title: 46-year-old man killed by speeding car in Delhi's Greater Kailash
159.article_body: A 46-year-old man was allegedly killed by a speeding car in Delhi's Greater Kailash area on Sunday, police said on Tuesday. The victim was hit by the car while he was walking and was thrown onto the pavement, police added. Police further said the victim was lying unconscious on the pavement for a long time before a passerby spotted him.

160.title: World's most powerful telescope captures 'water signature' on distant planet
160.article_body: NASA's James Webb Space Telescope has captured the distinct signature of water in the atmosphere of a distant planet orbiting a Sun-like star 1,150 light-years away. It has been captured on the giant gas planet WASP 96-b located in the Milky Way. NASA made the revelation while releasing a batch of photos taken by the world's most powerful telescope.

161.title: I think Tom Cruise is irrelevant, he's been doing the same part for 35 yrs: Mickey Rourke
161.article_body: Actor Mickey Rourke called Tom Cruise "irrelevant" and said "he has no respect" for how Tom chooses his roles. In an interview, Mickey was asked what he felt about Tom starring in 'Top Gun: Maverick', to which he replied, "That doesn't mean sh** to me...[He's]...been doing the same...part for 35 years." Mickey added he doesn't care about money and power.

162.title: Mysterious phenomenon of 'milky sea' caught on camera for first time
162.article_body: A satellite captured an image of a rare case of milky sea in the south of Indonesia, a phenomenon where the water lightens because of luminous bacteria. A team of researchers from the US confirmed a crew on a private yacht encountered the milky sea, something that is believed to appear only once or twice per year around the globe.

163.title: I am an actor because of sir: Rajkummar on mimicking SRK in college days
163.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao recalled how he would mimic actor Shah Rukh Khan when he was studying at The Film and Television Institute of India (FTII). "I used to mimic Shah Rukh Khan and Manoj Kumar, I still like...(Shah Rukh) a lot," he added. "I'm still a huge fan. Me and my friends....we still mimic Shah Rukh sir [sometimes]," Rajkummar said.

164.title: Over 5,000 civilians killed since start of war in Ukraine: UN
164.article_body: The UN human rights office (OHCHR) on Tuesday said that more than 5,000 civilians had been killed and over 6,500 others had been injured in Ukraine since the start of Russia's invasion on February 24. The real toll was likely much higher, it added. OHCHR has dozens of human rights monitors in the country.

165.title: Manipur orders closure of schools as COVID-19 cases increase
165.article_body: The Manipur government on Tuesday issued an order to close all schools in the state with immediate effect due to the sharp increase in COVID-19 cases. The schools will remain closed till July 24, 2022. This comes as 59 people in Manipur tested positive for the virus on Tuesday and the test positivity ratio crossed the 15% mark.

166.title: Bumrah was just phenomenal in 1st ODI vs England: Tendulkar
166.article_body: Following Jasprit Bumrah's 6/19 in India's 10-wicket win against England in first ODI, Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "Great bowling performance by India's pace attack especially Bumrah who was just phenomenal." He added, "The Oval pitch has great bounce but Indian bowlers bowled...right lengths." Notably, Bumrah became the first Indian pacer to take six wickets in an ODI in England on Tuesday.

167.title: Opting to bowl first was a right call: Rohit on India's 10-wicket win
167.article_body: After India defeated England by 10 wickets in first ODI at The Oval, captain Rohit Sharma said opting to bowl first after winning the toss was a right call to make by looking at overhead conditions and the pitch. "There was some swing...seam upfront and we exploited them well," he added. India bundled out England for 110 in 25.2 overs.

168.title: Country does not need a silent President: Yashwant Sinha
168.article_body: Presidential election candidate Yashwant Sinha said that the country does not need a silent president but rather someone who uses moral authority and discretion. Yashwant Sinha is the opposition candidate for the upcoming Presidential polls. Sinha accused the ruling party of misusing central agencies like the CBI against political rivals and said he will stop such acts if elected.

169.title: CBI chargesheet meets requirements: Court on denying Deshmukh's bail
169.article_body: While refusing default bail to ex-Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh in a corruption case, a court stated that CBI's chargesheet against him met all requirements. Deshmukh had sought bail over claims that the chargesheet hadn't been submitted within the 60-day mandated period and that the chargesheet was incomplete. Courts cannot be too technical while entertaining bail pleas, the court said.

170.title: SAD's youth wing to take out tractor march against ban on 2 songs
170.article_body: Shiromani Akali Dal's (SAD) youth wing Youth Akali Dal has announced that it'll take out a tractor march on Thursday in protest against the Centre's ban on two Punjabi Songs. YAD president Parambans Romana said SAD views the Centre's ban on 'SYL' by late Sidhu Moosewala and 'Rihai' by Kanwar Grewal as an attempt to suppress the voice of Punjabis.

171.title: I stay out of VC ecosystem as I don't believe in it: Zoho Co-founder
171.article_body: Zoho Co-founder and CEO Sridhar Vembu has said that he doesn't believe in the venture capital (VC) ecosystem. "I stay out of the VC ecosystem because I fundamentally don't believe in it. The thing I see (with VC-funded companies) is that it's all too exit-focused," he said. Notably, Zoho has never raised any VC funding to date.

172.title: Lightspeed raises new $500 mn fund for India, Southeast Asia
172.article_body: Lightspeed Venture Partners, a Silicon-valley headquartered firm, has announced the closure of its $500 million fund dedicated to India and Southeast Asia. Lightspeed has invested in OYO, Udaan, BYJU'S, Razorpay, and ShareChat and looks to further invest in early-stage startups. The new fund comes from a $7 billion capital that the VC firm has raised to invest in startups globally.

173.title: Miscreants attack Punjab Advocate General in train near Panipat
173.article_body: Unidentified miscreants attacked Punjab Advocate General Anmol Rattan Sidhu while he was travelling on a Shatabdi train from Delhi to Chandigarh on Tuesday. The assailants allegedly pelted stones at Sidhu's bogie, breaking the windowpane of his compartment after the train crossed Haryana's Panipat. Notably, Sidhu had appeared in the Supreme Court on Monday in relation to the Lawrence Bishnoi case.

174.title: J&K sets up transgender welfare board to protect their rights
