174.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir administration has announced that they have set up a transgender welfare board for the protection of the rights of the minority population. The total population of transgenders in Jammu and Kashmir was 4,137 as per the 2011 census. The Chief Secretary will be the head of the 13-member welfare board, an official order stated.

175.title: Activist & Padma Shri awardee Avdhash Kaushal passes away at 84
175.article_body: Social activist and Padma Shri awardee Avdhash Kaushal passed away at 84 on Tuesday following a prolonged illness. Kaushal died at a private hospital in Dehradun. He headed the Rural Litigation and Entitlement Kendra NGO which was focused on development work amongst tribal communities in the Dehradun district. He founded the NGO in the late 1970s.

176.title: Karti Chidambaram's bail plea hearing adjourned till August 18
176.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday adjourned the hearing on the anticipatory bail plea of Congress leader Karti Chidambaram till August 18. Justice Poonam A Bamba adjourned the matter since Additional Solicitor General SV Raju was unavailable. Karti is seeking anticipatory bail in a money laundering case related to the Chinese visa scam.

177.title: K'taka bus cleaner dies, his parents praised for donating organs
177.article_body: A 24-year-old bus cleaner from Karnataka has passed away after being critically injured in a road accident last week. The state's Health Minister Dr K Sudhakar praised the man's parents for their generosity as they have donated the deceased's organs. "[Naveen Kumar's] liver, kidney, heart valve and retina have been transplanted and will give life to others," the minister tweeted.

178.title: 65-yr-old cheating accused jumps off court building in Surat, dies
178.article_body: Police said that a 65-year-old man, Bharat Italia, who was accused in a cheating case, jumped to death from the second floor of a court building in Gujarat's Surat on Tuesday. While being escorted back from the court, the accused suddenly escaped and jumped from the building, a police official said. Italia was taken to a hospital where he died.

179.title: Situation in Sri Lanka is very sensitive & complicated: Jaishankar
179.article_body: Replying to a media query, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Tuesday said, "The situation in Sri Lanka is very sensitive, it's very complicated. Even as we speak many developments are taking place." India has been extremely supportive of Sri Lankans in the last few months, he added. Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa is due to step down tomorrow.

180.title: NIA court extends police remand of 3 accused in Udaipur murder case
180.article_body: An NIA court on Tuesday extended the police custody of three of the accused in the Udaipur murder case till Saturday. The remaining four accused have been sent to judicial custody. The men remanded to NIA custody include Riaz Akhtari and Ghouse Mohammad, who killed Udaipur tailor Kanhaiya Lal in June for avenging an alleged insult to Islam.

181.title: Iran arrests 3 filmmakers in less than 1 week amid govt crackdown
181.article_body: Iran has arrested prominent filmmaker Jafar Panahi, the third arrest in less than a week amid a crackdown by the government, reports stated on Tuesday. Panahi had reportedly gone to the prosecutor's office to check on his colleagues, who were detained recently when he was also imprisoned. Panahi has been reportedly sent to jail to serve a previous prison term.

182.title: Venezuelan refugee women face rising violence in Colombia, Peru: Report
182.article_body: Amnesty International in a report on Tuesday said that Venezuelan refugee women face rising gender-based violence in Peru and Colombia. Gender-based violence against Venezuelan women in Colombia increased by 71% between 2018 and 2021, and in Peru by 31% between 2019 and 2021, official government data showed. Over 60 lakh people have fled Venezuela amid an economic crisis.

183.title: IndiGo starts disciplinary proceedings after mass sick leaves: Report
183.article_body: IndiGo has started disciplinary proceedings against aeroplane maintenance technicians who went on mass sick leave for five days, PTI reported. The airline has asked concerned technicians to come in and see the airline doctor along with any appropriate medical records so the company can confirm they were genuinely ill, the report said. The technicians took leave to protest inadequate pay.

184.title: Hotel industry revenues to return to pre-COVID levels in FY23: ICRA
184.article_body: The hotel industry's revenues and margins are expected to return to pre-COVID levels in FY23, ratings agency ICRA said. Demand will be mainly driven by domestic leisure and transient travel, although there will be a gradual recovery in business travel and foreign tourist arrivals, ICRA said. Pan-India premium hotel occupancy is expected to be at 68-70% for FY23, it added.

185.title: NIA court extends police remand of 3 accused in Udaipur murder case
185.article_body: An NIA court on Tuesday extended the police custody of three of the accused in the Udaipur murder case till Saturday. The remaining four accused have been sent to judicial custody. The men remanded to NIA custody include Riaz Akhtari and Ghouse Mohammad, who killed Udaipur tailor Kanhaiya Lal in June for avenging an alleged insult to Islam.

210.title: Croatia to become 20th country to adopt euro as currency
210.article_body: European Union (EU) on Tuesday formally approved Croatia's accession to the eurozone, paving the way for the Balkan nation to adopt euro as its currency from January 1, 2023. This confirms that the euro remained an "attractive, resilient and successful global currency", European Commission Vice President Valdis Dombrovskis said. "It's a big day for Croatia," the Croatian Finance Minister said.

211.title: 1st batch of full-colour images taken from world's most powerful space telescope released
211.article_body: NASA on Tuesday released new full-colour images taken from James Webb Space Telescope, the world's most powerful space telescope. It released images of Southern Ring planetary nebula, showing a dying star cloaked by dust and layers of light. Another image shows Stephan's Quintet, a visual grouping of five galaxies. An image revealing baby stars in Carina Nebula was also released.

212.title: Drug peddler's properties worth ₹83.2 lakh attached in Haryana
212.article_body: The properties of a drug peddler, Gurmez Singh alias Gurmail, were attached and his assets were frozen in Haryana's Kaithal district on Tuesday. Police said Singh had purchased properties worth ₹83.22 lakh from the proceeds of drug peddling. "On the request of Haryana Police, a competent authority in New Delhi, passed orders to freeze movable and immovable assets," police said.

213.title: ODI or Test cricket, no better pair in world cricket: Sehwag on Bumrah, Shami
213.article_body: Praising Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammad Shami following their bowling performances in the first ODI against England, Virender Sehwag said, "One day cricket or Test cricket, no better pair in world cricket. Bumrah and Shami are a class apart." Bumrah posted bowling figures of 7.2-3-19-6, while Shami registered 7-0-31-3. India defeated England by 10 wickets at The Oval.

214.title: Assam govt appoints 280 specially-abled candidates as teachers
214.article_body: Assam government on Tuesday distributed appointment letters to 280 specially-abled candidates for the post of teachers across different schools in various districts of the state. The letters were distributed by Assam Education Minister Dr Ranoj Pegu during a programme held in Guwahati. As many as 193 candidates were appointed in lower primary schools and the rest in upper primary schools.

215.title: New images of the universe taken from world's most powerful space telescope released
215.article_body: NASA on Tuesday released new images taken from James Webb Space Telescope, the world's most powerful space telescope. It released images of the Southern Ring planetary nebula, showing a dying star cloaked by dust and layers of light. Another image shows Stephan's Quintet, a visual grouping of five galaxies. An image revealing baby stars in Carina Nebula was also released.

216.title: Staff misbehaved, made racist remarks: Khali on allegedly slapping toll staffer
216.article_body: After a Punjab toll staff accused former WWE wrestler Dalip Singh Rana aka The Great Khali of slapping one of the employees, the latter said the staffer had stopped his car and "misbehaved for a selfie". "When I denied the selfie, they ruthlessly passed racist comments and used bad words," said Khali. A video of the argument earlier went viral.

217.title: Coronavirus pandemic is nowhere near over: WHO chief
217.article_body: World Health Organization (WHO) Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus on Tuesday said, "COVID-19 is nowhere near over." "As the virus pushes at us, we must push back," he added. WHO's Emergency Committee, made up of independent experts, said rising cases, ongoing viral evolution and pressure on health services in a number of countries meant that the situation was still an emergency.

218.title: Bless and support me: Droupadi Murmu to YSRCP leaders in Andhra
218.article_body: NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu met YSRCP leaders in Andhra Pradesh's Amaravati on Tuesday as part of her election campaign and requested them to bless and support her. "Andhra and Odisha are neighbours and have many similarities in food habits, dress and customs," Murmu said. "I thank Jagan Mohan Reddy for extending support even before I requested," she added.

219.title: It'll take 89m plus to win in Eugene: Neeraj ahead of World Athletics C'ships
219.article_body: Ahead of World Athletics Championships 2022, reigning Olympic gold medallist javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra said there is no pressure. "I train well and give [my] 100% in competition," he added. Neeraj, who threw a personal best of 89.94 metres at Stockholm Diamond League last month said, "I'm close to 90 metres...it'll take 89 metres plus to win in Eugene."

220.title: Jharkhand will become leading state if Centre's support continues: CM
220.article_body: Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren on Tuesday said that the state would be one of the leading states in the next five to seven years if support from the Centre continued. "Jharkhand has been contributing to nation building for years through its minerals, including coal and iron," Soren said, reminding that the state's contribution should not be forgotten.

221.title: Drone startups raise $87 mn since new govt rules in 2021
221.article_body: After the change in rules for the drone sector in August 2021, the industry has seen a funding boost of $87 million in the last year, according market researcher Venture Intelligence's data. As more sectors use drones, 10 startups received funding, double from last year. Companies such as ideaForge raised $20 million, and The ePlane Company raised $5 million.

222.title: Rajkummar, Sanya host screening of 'HIT: The First Case' for Delhi Police
222.article_body: Actors Rajkummar Rao and Sanya Malhotra along with director Sailesh Kolanu hosted a special screening of their upcoming film 'HIT: The First Case' for Delhi Police on Monday. Actress Huma Qureshi also attended the screening. Delhi Police officials were extremely happy with the film's story and appreciated it for showcasing the real investigative police world, reported Free Press Journal.

223.title: Sonali revisits hospital where she underwent cancer treatment, says 'Was unreal'
223.article_body: Actress Sonali Bendre shared a video on her Instagram handle, recalling her cancer journey as she revisited the same hospital where she underwent cancer treatment. Sharing the video, she wrote, "Four years later, from sheer terror to continued hope, so much has changed yet so much remains the same. It was unreal...I felt like telling the patients that there's hope."

224.title: 5,000 Delhi govt school kids given free CUET coaching classes: Sisodia
224.article_body: Delhi's Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia revealed that over 5,000 Delhi government school students were provided free preparatory classes for Common University Entrance Test (CUET). Many students couldn't afford high coaching fees, he said, adding, "The initiative ensured that [they] don't consider giving up dreams because of financial reasons." The students were guided in over 13 subjects.

225.title: Govt cracks down on industrial usage of urea intended for farmers
225.article_body: The Chemicals and Fertilizers Ministry has launched a nationwide crackdown to curb the use of agricultural-grade urea by industries. The ministry also launched a flying squad for taking strict action against this. According to an official, the diversion causes subsidy leakage worth ₹6,000 crore while leakages worth ₹100 crore were identified in the last 2.5 months.

226.title: German auto components firm Bosch to invest over ₹200 crore in India
226.article_body: German auto components firm Bosch will invest ₹200 crore in India over next five years in advanced automotive technologies and digital mobility space, Managing Director Soumitra Bhattacharya said. The company is also "quietly and cautiously" optimistic about having double-digit growth in FY2022-23 over the previous fiscal, he added. In 2021-22, Bosch recorded a profit after tax of ₹1,217 crore.

227.title: CBI may question senior journalist in NSE phone tapping case: Report
227.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) is likely to question a senior journalist in Mumbai in connection with the alleged phone tapping of National Stock Exchange (NSE) employees, Moneycontrol reported. CBI found the journalist had introduced former Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey to former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna. Pandey is also being probed in the matter.

228.title: I will only make 'Thor 5' with Chris Hemsworth: Taika Waititi
228.article_body: Filmmaker Taika Waititi has stated that he will only make another 'Thor' film if actor Chris Hemsworth is a part of it. "But it would need to be something surprising and unexpected for me to want to do it...The battles and...the fighting is fine, but I would want something that feels unexpected when it comes to the story," he added.

229.title: Nothing is planned yet: Suniel on rumours of Athiya, Rahul getting married
229.article_body: Suniel Shetty reacted to the reports that his daughter, Athiya Shetty, and cricketer KL Rahul are getting married in the next three months. Dismissing the rumours, Suniel said, "Nothing has been planned yet." A report in a news portal suggested that the couple has apparently bought a place together and will move into their new house after tying the knot.

230.title: CUET will be conducted in 2 phases starting July 15: UGC
230.article_body: The Common University Entrance Test (CUET) for admission to UG courses will be conducted in two phases starting from July 15, University Grants Commission (UGC) Chairman M Jagadesh Kumar said. The examinations will end on August 20. The admit cards for the first phase were issued today. "We're issuing admit cards just four days before...examinations...to ensure good security," Kumar said.

231.title: Never seen such shameless misuse of central agencies: Sinha
231.article_body: Opposition candidate for Presidential polls Yashwant Sinha on Tuesday criticised the Central government and said that he's never seen such blatant, shameless misuse of central agencies to fix rivals. He said that elections for the post of President are taking place in troubled conditions, adding that democracy is in grave danger. The economy is badly mismanaged, he added.

232.title: Fintech startup Hesa to financially empower 60,000 rural merchants
232.article_body: Hyderabad-based agri-fintech startup Hesa announced that it's aiming to provide financial solutions to 60,000 rural entrepreneurs including farmers across 30,000 villages in Telangana. Through this programme, Hesa will offer ease of transactions such as bill payments, opening an account, withdrawing money, among others. It aims to reduce the financial challenges faced by the rural population.

233.title: BJP is a 'control-freak', 'dossier-loving' government: Congress MP
233.article_body: Congress MP Abhishek Singhvi on Tuesday accused the BJP of being a "control freak" and "dossier loving" government. Singhvi further said the BJP government has created an atmosphere of "fear, trepidation, anxiety and hesitation" among the judicial sector by the misuse of the "dossier raj". "BJP has indulged in several manipulative tactics qua the judiciary," Singhvi added.

234.title: SC upholds life terms for 4 convicts for plotting terror attacks
234.article_body: The Supreme Court has upheld the life sentence awarded to four people for plotting terror attacks in India. The convicts, guilty of having links with Lashkar-e-Taiba, were arrested during investigations of the 2005 attack at Bangalore's Indian Institute of Science. The convicts had moved the Supreme Court after the Karnataka High Court increased their seven-year sentence to life term.

235.title: India defeat England by 10 wickets in an ODI for the first time in history
235.article_body: India chased down a 111-run target against England in 18.4 overs without losing a wicket to win the first ODI at London's Kennington Oval. It's the first time in ODI cricket history that India defeated England by a margin of 10 wickets. England were bowled out for 110 runs in the match, which is their lowest ODI total against India.

236.title: Was rejected for my eyebrows, I was like 'What about acting?': Rajkummar
236.article_body: When asked about his early days and the kind of rejections he faced, Rajkummar Rao said, "I was told so many things. You're not tall enough, your build is not right, your eyebrows are a little…not in a certain shape." "[I heard] very weird things. I was like ‘What? What about acting?’ Voh kisko chahiye? (Who wants that?)" he added.

237.title: Audience is now used to consuming content at home: Naga Chaitanya
237.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya stated that the priority of the audience has shifted now, adding that they have become used to the idea of consuming content at home. He added that he chooses scripts based on this. "They are not putting down the film or insulting it in any way. It's just...how they have evolved post the pandemic," the actor said.

238.title: Can't take my eyes off this performance: Bhogle on Bumrah's 6/19 at The Oval
238.article_body: Commentator Harsha Bhogle took to Twitter to praise India pacer Jasprit Bumrah following his 6/19 in the first ODI against England at The Oval. "What a spell! Can't take my eyes off this performance by Bumrah," he wrote. Wasim Jaffer tweeted, "Alexa, please play Bumrah. Sorry, Bumrah is unplayable." England were bowled out for 110 in 25.2 overs.

239.title: Around 60 startups have registered with ISRO: MoS Jitendra Singh
239.article_body: Minister of State for Science, Technology and Space Jitendra Singh said that around 60 startups have registered with ISRO since PM Narendra Modi "unlocked" the space sector. He added that while a few startups are dealing with space debris management, proposals have also been received for other services. He also lauded the PM for allowing private players in space sector.

240.title: Russian journalist fined ₹1.6 lakh under 'gay propaganda' law
240.article_body: A Russian journalist was fined 120,000 roubles (₹1.6 lakh) by a Moscow court on Tuesday under law that prohibits "propaganda" in support of gay relationships. Yury Dud, who has notably also denounced Russian invasion of Ukraine, was fined due to interview he conducted with a homosexual artist, lawyer said. Russia criminalised "propagandising" non-traditional sexual orientations to minors in 2013.

241.title: Kichcha Sudeepa pays school fees of two students in Bengaluru
241.article_body: Actor-singer Kichcha Sudeepa has assisted two students in their education by paying their school fees. The students, who attend Chamarajpet Ram Mandir school in Bengaluru, were unable to go to school because of financial issues. Earlier, he had adopted a government school in his home town Shivamogga in Karnataka which is said to be around 133 years old.

242.title: Govt will raise funds from capital market for road projects: Gadkari
242.article_body: Union Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari said on Tuesday that the government will raise funds from capital markets for road projects. "I don't want to use the finances of rich people. I'm going to share market, and...I'm going to take investments from small people," he said. The construction equipment industry is facing problems due to rising crude oil prices, he added.

243.title: I am naturally disappointed: Vijay Mallya on 4-month jail sentence
243.article_body: Fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya said he was "naturally disappointed" at the Supreme Court verdict sentencing him to four months in jail in a 2017 contempt of court case. Mallya was convicted of contempt in 2017 for transferring $40 million to his children in violation of court orders. The apex court also imposed a fine of ₹2,000 on him.

244.title: First made-in-India qHPV vaccine against cervical cancer in women gets DCGI's approval
244.article_body: The DCGI granted market authorisation to Serum Institute of India (SII) to manufacture indigenously-developed India's first Quadrivalent Human Papillomavirus vaccine (qHPV) against cervical cancer in women. Saying the vaccine will be "affordable and accessible", SII CEO Adar Poonawalla said, "We look forward to launching it later this year and we thank...DCGI @MoHFW_INDIA for granting approval."

245.title: It was a good learning: Suryakumar on his 117 in India's 17-run loss
245.article_body: India batter Suryakumar Yadav, who scored his maiden T20I century(117) in third T20I against England, said he's happy with the way things went in Nottingham. "At the same time I felt that there was a slight opportunity to take the team past the line. It happens, it was a learning process," he added. India lost the match by 17 runs.

246.title: I was approached for 'Aarya' but it didn't work for me: Kajol Devgan
246.article_body: Kajol Devgan said she was approached for 'Aarya'. When asked if she has watched the show, Kajol said, "I did…I liked the script very much. But it didn’t work out for me...at that time." ''Was it due to date issues? There were other reasons for it," she added. The series was later remade with Sushmita Sen as the titular character.

247.title: 3 Kerala men found guilty of recruiting youngsters to Islamic State
247.article_body: A National Investigation Agency (NIA) court has found three men from Kerala guilty of recruiting youngsters to the Islamic State with the intention of waging a war against India. Earlier, the NIA found that one of the accused, 60-year-old UK Hamsa, acted as a propagandist of the IS ideology in Kerala and helped radicalise around 20 youngsters.

248.title: ASI martyred, 2 policemen injured as terrorists open fire in J&K
248.article_body: An Assistant Sub-Inspector (ASI) was martyred and two other police personnel sustained injuries after terrorists open fired upon a police party in the Lal Bazar area of Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar on Tuesday. The injured personnel have been shifted to a hospital. Police said the area has been cordoned off to track down the attackers, who managed to escape.

249.title: Rahul leaves for personal visit abroad, to skip key Congress meeting
249.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi left for a personal visit overseas on Tuesday, the party confirmed, but didn't disclose any details about the visit. Rahul will skip a crucial Congress meeting on July 14 to discuss the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' and internal party elections. All senior Congress members, including general secretaries, in-charges and PCC presidents, have been invited to the meeting.

250.title: Side-by-side pics show how powerful James Webb Space Telescope is compared to Hubble
250.article_body: Hours after the first image captured by the James Webb Space Telescope was released, Twitter users shared photos comparing the new telescope with its predecessor Hubble. Many users posted side-by-side images to show the difference between them. While the images taken by James Webb telescope are sharper, those captured by Hubble appear to lack in details.

251.title: Jharkhand to get airports in Bokaro, Jamshedpur & Dumka: Scindia
251.article_body: Union Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia on Tuesday said that Jharkhand will get three more airports, taking the total number of airports in the state to five. The new airports will be built in Bokaro, Jamshedpur and Dumka, he added. Scindia also said that 14 new air routes will be made available in the state to increase connectivity.

252.title: I cut off from people after divorce with Karan Singh Grover: Jennifer Winget
252.article_body: Actress Jennifer Winget has revealed that she cut off from people after her divorce with actor Karan Singh Grover. She said, "I used to see people looking at me with those sad, sympathetic eyes like, 'Arrey bechari yaar,' and that used to piss me off more." Jennifer and Karan got married in 2012 and separated in 2014.

253.title: BRO reconstructs bridge destroyed by flash flood in Arunachal in 7 days
253.article_body: The Border Roads Organisation (BRO) has reconstructed a strategic bridge in Kurung Kumey district of Arunachal Pradesh in seven days. The Bailey Bridge on Koloriang-Lee-Huri road in the district was destroyed in a major flash flood earlier this month. The reconstruction was a challenging task posed by tough circumstances including incessant rains and landslides, a senior official said.

254.title: Tough for Bhuvneshwar to get in India XI for T20 WC with Bumrah, Shami: Gough
254.article_body: Ex-England pacer Darren Gough said it will be difficult for Bhuvneshwar Kumar to get in the T20 World Cup playing XI with Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammad Shami already in the side and with youngsters who are coming through having terrific pace. He added that with Bhuvneshwar's swing bowling skills he will be a massive player for India in Australia.

255.title: Shortcut politics can destroy the nation: PM Modi in Deoghar
255.article_body: Addressing a rally in Jharkhand's Deoghar, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that shortcut politics based on populist measures can destroy the nation. "If the politics of one country depends on shortcut politics, then it will lead to a short circuit," PM Modi said. "Those who do politics of shortcut will never build new airports, modern highways," he added.

256.title: 2 killed, 4 injured in a road accident in Assam's Dhemaji
256.article_body: Police said that two persons were killed and four others were critically injured when the vehicle in which they were travelling hit the railing of a damaged bridge in Assam's Dhemaji district on Tuesday. The driver of the vehicle, carrying eight passengers from Arunachal Pradesh's Pasighat to Assam's Silapathar lost control, killing two persons on the spot, police added.

257.title: Over 60 killed in Pak's Balochistan in rain-related incidents
257.article_body: As many as 62 people, including 24 children, have lost their lives in Pakistan's Balochistan due to rain-related incidents, officials said. Torrential rains in the region have reportedly destroyed more than 670 houses and injured about 50 people. Separately, the Pakistan Meteorological Department (PMD) has predicted "heavy to very heavy" rains in Karachi from July 14 to July 17.

258.title: Sara says she wants to date Vijay Deverakonda on 'Koffee...', actor reacts
258.article_body: The new promo of celebrity talk show 'Koffee With Karan' shows actress Sara Ali Khan saying that she wants to date Telugu actor Vijay Deverakonda. Vijay shared a video of the promo on Instagram Stories, writing, "I love how you say 'Deverakonda'. Cutest. Sending big hugs and my affection." Sara will appear on the show with actress Janhvi Kapoor.

259.title: I think I'm more Nadal than I am Federer: Golfer Mcllroy
259.article_body: Golfer Rory Mcllroy said he's more like Rafael Nadal than Roger Federer. "But I'm not. I just don't have his [Nadal] grit and will," he added. Mcllroy further said that he still loves playing golf like 40-year-old Federer still loves playing tennis after having an unbelievably successful and long career. Federer has won 20 Grand Slams and Nadal 22.

260.title: 4 of family, including 2 children, die of electrocution in T'gana
260.article_body: Police said four members of a family, including two children, died due to electrocution in Telangana's Kamareddy on Tuesday. The incident took place when a live wire running from a pole to their house fell on them due to incessant rains, killing 35-year-old Ahmed, 30-year-old Parveen, six-year-old Maheen and four-year-old Adnan. A case was registered under Section 174 of CrPC.

261.title: US airstrike kills leader of Islamic State in Syria
261.article_body: Maher al-Agal, one of the top five ISIS leaders and the leader of ISIS in Syria, has been killed in a US air strike, the US military said on Tuesday. A senior ISIS official closely associated with Maher was seriously injured during the strike. "An initial review indicates there were no civilian casualties," the statement added.

262.title: England record their lowest-ever total against India in ODI cricket
262.article_body: England were dismissed for 110 runs in 25.2 overs against India in the first ODI at London's Kennington Oval. It is England's lowest-ever total against India in ODI cricket. As many as four England batters were dismissed without scoring a run in the match. England's previous lowest ODI total against India was 125, registered on October 15, 2006 in Jaipur.

263.title: Bumrah records best-ever ODI bowling figures by an Indian outside Asia
263.article_body: Team India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah has set the record for registering the best-ever bowling figures in an ODI by an Indian bowler outside Asia. The 28-year-old registered figures of 7.2-3-19-6 against England in the first ODI at The Oval to set the record. The previous record was held by Kuldeep Yadav, who had recorded 10-0-25-6 against England in Nottingham.

264.title: Thailand to offer chemical castration to sex offenders in return for shorter jail term
264.article_body: Thailand is close to enacting a law allowing voluntary chemical castration of sex offenders. A Bill has been passed by the Thai Senate that will enable authorities to offer chemical castration to sex criminals in return to have their prison sentences shortened. Convicts will be offered injections to reduce their testosterone levels as part of the castration treatment.

265.title: Bajrang Dal worker assaulted by 5 men in Karnataka, 2 arrested
265.article_body: A Bajrang Dal worker named Kantharaj has alleged that five men assaulted him in Karnataka's Shivamogga on Monday night. In a police complaint, Kantharaj claimed the men had ambushed him outside his house. In an interview with Times Now, he said he was attacked only because of his connection to the Bajrang Dal. Two of the accused have been arrested.

266.title: Sri Lankan Prez hasn't taken refuge at Air Force chief's home, says SLAF
266.article_body: A Sri Lanka Air Force spokesman on Tuesday rejected reports that President Gotabaya Rajapaksa was currently staying at a house belonging to SLAF chief Air Marshal Sudarshana Pathirana. "There was no truth behind the reports and it was propaganda to tarnish the image of the SLAF and its chief," he added. Pathirana also rejected the claim made by the reports.

267.title: Aamir was constantly on painkillers while filming 'Laal...' running scene: Report
267.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan was constantly on painkillers while filming the running sequence in his upcoming film 'Laal Singh Chaddha', as per reports. The actor had reportedly suffered a knee injury and was undergoing physiotherapy at the time. The reports added that Aamir didn't want to wait for the shoot because the film had already been delayed due to the pandemic.

268.title: Vidyut Jammwal & Nandita Mahtani to tie the knot in London this month: Reports
268.article_body: Vidyut Jammwal will reportedly tie the knot with fashion designer Nandita Mahtani in London this month. According to reports, they might make the news of their wedding public in the next 15 days. Nandita is currently in London and Vidyut will reportedly join her soon. Vidyut confirmed he's dating Nandita by sharing a picture with her on Instagram last year.

269.title: 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' will face criticism: Karan Johar
269.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar has said that his upcoming film 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' will face criticism, adding that it is good since it helps him improve. "I read the criticism before the praise...What's bad or what's mediocre needs to be told," he added. 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' features Alia Bhatt, Ranveer Singh, Shabana Azmi and Dharmendra.

270.title: HCL Tech Q1 profit rises 2.11% to ₹3,281 crore, company declares ₹10 dividend
270.article_body: HCL Technologies on Tuesday reported a consolidated net profit of ₹3,281 crore in the June quarter, up 2.11% from ₹3,213 crore in the corresponding quarter last year. The company's consolidated revenue increased by 16.92% to ₹23,464 crore as against ₹20,068 crore reported in the year-ago period. The company has declared a dividend of ₹10 per share.

271.title: Former Punjab MLA Simarjeet Bains booked for ignoring court summons
271.article_body: Former Punjab MLA Simarjeet Singh Bains was booked for skipping court summons a day after he surrendered before a Ludhiana court in a rape case. An FIR under Section 174A of the Indian Penal Code has been registered at the division number 5 police station on the orders of Chief Judicial Magistrate Sumit Makkar.

272.title: Indian eagle-owl rescued from school premises in Thane amid rains
272.article_body: An Indian eagle-owl was rescued from a school in Thane on Monday amidst heavy rainfall. "The owl was attacked by crows and was trying to hide in the school. It was wet and in trauma," a member of NGO Wildlife Welfare Association (WWA) said. A veterinarian has confirmed that there were no external or internal injuries.

273.title: BJP leaders should support 'old friend' Sinha in Prez polls: Baghel
273.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Tuesday appealed to the BJP leaders to support "their old friend Yashwant Sinha" in the upcoming Presidential elections. "If the BJP is listening to its inner voice, their old friend (Yashwant Sinha) is the candidate of the Opposition," he said when asked about BJP's appeal to support NDA Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu.

274.title: Fire breaks out in building in Delhi's Janakpuri, 4 rescued
274.article_body: A fire broke out in an office in Delhi's Janakpuri on Tuesday. The fire was reported on the 11th floor of the Kirti Shikhar tower located near Janak Puri Police Station. Around 11 fire tenders attended the scene and four persons were rescued. According to officials, no casualty was reported. They said the incident was reported at around 12:30 pm.

275.title: It was blown out of proportion: Vikram on hospitalisation over chest discomfort
275.article_body: Tamil actor Vikram has reacted to the reports of being hospitalised over a heart attack, saying that he had suffered mild chest discomfort. "But it was blown out of proportion. I am doing well," the actor added. He was admitted to Chennai's Kauvery Hospital on Friday ahead of the audio launch of his upcoming Tamil film 'Cobra'.

276.title: Crocodile held captive in MP as people claim it 'swallowed' 10-yr-old boy, pic surfaces
276.article_body: A crocodile was captured by residents of a village who insisted that the reptile had swallowed a 10-year-old boy bathing in a river in Madhya Pradesh's Sheopur district. The villagers captured the crocodile using a net, insisting that the child was still alive in its stomach, an official said. A team from the police and forest department rescued the crocodile.

277.title: Woman extorts ₹56 lakh from elected representative in Mumbai, booked
277.article_body: Mumbai's Sakinaka Police have booked a woman for allegedly extorting ₹56 lakh from an elected representative in Maharashtra by threatening to tarnish his personal and political image. According to police, the woman met complainant in 2020 and sought monetary assistance from him. She allegedly blackmailed the man, claiming that she'll expose their 'illicit affair' if he didn't give the money.

278.title: Tamil Nadu CM tests COVID-19 positive, urges citizens to wear masks
278.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin on Tuesday said that he has tested positive for coronavirus and is under isolation. Taking to Twitter, the CM added that he got himself tested as he was "feeling a bit tired". Stalin also urged citizens to wear masks, get vaccinated against COVID-19 and stay safe.

279.title: Statue atop Parliament is a copy of National Emblem: Sculptor on 'distortion' claims
279.article_body: Sculptor Sunil Deore has refuted claims of 'distorting' expression of lions in the National Emblem statue installed on top of the new Parliament building. "We've tried to perfectly copy the sculpture at Sarnath," said Deore, adding, "We studied the original sculpture before enlarging it." Many opposition leaders have claimed the lions were made to look "angry" in the new sculpture.

280.title: I feel like an underdog, people don't consider me among top heroines: Taapsee
280.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu said she doesn't feel "very settled with" the fact that she's headlining films now. "I still feel like an underdog. If you ask a layman who are...top 2-3 heroines of the industry, I don’t think I'll be on that list," she added. "You have those days when you feel...Why am I still not there," Taapsee said.

281.title: 3 arrested for mobile phone thefts in Mumbai, 26 phones recovered
281.article_body: Three people were arrested and 26 stolen mobile phones were recovered from their possession in Mumbai's Kurla, police said on Tuesday. One of the accused (Arif Khokhar) stole mobile phones and sold them to the other accused at a cheaper rate, a police official said. Khokhar is a drug addict with multiple mobile phone thefts to his name, he added.

282.title: Barmy Army troll Virat Kohli for missing first ODI against England, fans react
282.article_body: England's Barmy Army trolled Virat Kohli for missing first ODI against England due to a groin strain. Sharing a picture, Barmy Army insinuated that Kohli has been dropped and injury was just an excuse. "This is disrespectful. You guys are crossing limits," a fan tweeted. Another wrote, "It'll be better you google 'How to play Bumrah' rather than making...useless memes."

283.title: England record lowest-ever score at the fall of 5th wicket against India in ODI cricket
283.article_body: England today recorded the lowest-ever score at the fall of fifth wicket against India in ODIs. England were restricted to 26/5 in 7.5 overs in the first ODI. Jason Roy, Joe Root, Ben Stokes and Liam Livingstone got out without scoring a run. The previous lowest ODI score at the fall of fifth wicket against India was 29/5 by Pakistan.

284.title: Siblings aged 4,5 & 8 drown in pit filled with rainwater in Pune
284.article_body: Three siblings, aged four, five and eight, drowned in a pit filled with rainwater on a farm in Ambethan village under the Pune district on Tuesday. Farmers had dug up a pit in which water had accumulated after heavy rain, said Inspector Dnyaneshwar Sabale, in-charge of Mahalunge police station. Siblings were playing on the farm in the morning, he added.

285.title: Class 12 student arrested for 'objectionable' FB post on UP CM
285.article_body: A Class 12 student has been arrested for allegedly posting an objectionable photograph of Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Facebook, police said. The accused, an 18-year-old boy named Ashish Yadav, had allegedly drawn something on the photograph. Police said they've seized his mobile phone and are investigating his other posts. Yadav is a resident of a village in Talgram.

286.title: Erdogan and Putin discussed Ukraine, duo to meet soon: Kremlin
286.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin and his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan held a telephonic discussion regarding facilitation of Ukrainian grain exports through the Black Sea, the Kremlin said on Monday. Both leaders plan to meet in the near future following the discussion, the Kremlin added. Turkey has been mediating between Moscow and Kyiv since the beginning of the ongoing war.

287.title: He's a great kid but he's got demons, in a way: McEnroe on Kyrgios
287.article_body: Talking about 2022 Wimbledon finalist Nick Kyrgios, ex-world number one John McEnroe said the Australian is a great kid and he's well liked in the locker room. "He does a lot of charity work. But he's got demons, in a way," he added. "Kyrgios moves the needle for us in tennis, we need this big time," McEnroe further said.

288.title: 10 Nigerians arrested in Gr Noida for possessing cannabis, liquor
288.article_body: Ten Nigerian nationals were arrested for possessing cannabis and a large quantity of liquor in Greater Noida on Monday. Over 300 gms of cannabis, 217 cans and bottles of beer and 17 bottles of whiskey were recovered from an apartment, a police spokesperson said. The arrested foreigners failed to produce valid documents for their stay in India, another official said.

289.title: Petition in Sri Lanka SC seeking travel ban on Rajapaksas, others
289.article_body: A petition has been filed in Sri Lanka's SC seeking an interim order restraining ex-PM Mahinda Rajapaksa, ex-Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa and other former ministers from travelling abroad without prior approval of the apex court. The petition was filed after Basil Rajapaksa was stopped from leaving at the Colombo airport. Notably, the whereabouts of President Gotabaya Rajapaksa is not known.

290.title: Cong appoints Raj, Chhattisgarh CMs as observers for Guj & HP polls
290.article_body: Congress on Tuesday appointed Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot and Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel as senior observers for the upcoming Assembly elections in Gujarat and Himachal Pradesh. TS Singh Deo and Milind Deora have been appointed observers for the Gujarat polls, while Sachin Pilot and Partap Singh Bajwa will be observers for the Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections, a party statement said.

291.title: Naga Chaitanya is very pure, honest and that inspires me: Krithi Shetty
291.article_body: Speaking about working with actor Naga Chaitanya in Venkat Prabhu's next, actress Krithi Shetty said, "I'm extremely excited to work with him because now that we have already worked together and I know how chill it is to work with him." "I have seen Chaitanya...he is really very soft, pure, honest and kind, and that inspires me," she added.

292.title: MNS chief postpones rally with party workers amid heavy rains in Maha
292.article_body: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray has postponed his rally with MNS workers which was scheduled for July 13, due to heavy rains in various parts of Maharashtra. He informed workers that he will soon announce the next date of his rally. He also asked party workers to reach out to the people affected due to heavy rains.

293.title: No shortage of funds for undertaking relief & rescue works: K'taka CM
293.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Tuesday said there is no shortage of funds for undertaking rescue and relief operations when many parts of the state are reeling under floods. Bommai said ₹730 crore is available with the National Disaster Response Fund (NDRF). "I too am visiting the affected areas...and will issue necessary instructions for rescue and relief works," Bommai added.

294.title: Russia fines Apple $33,900 for alleged data storage violation: Report
294.article_body: A court in Russia fined Apple 2 million roubles ($33,900) on Tuesday for allegedly refusing to store the data of Russian citizens on Russian territory, the news agency Interfax reported. Previously, the US tech giant was fined by the Netherlands several times for failing to comply with an order to provide non-Apple payment methods for dating apps.

295.title: Cut GST on substitutes to banned single-use plastic items: Minister
295.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai wrote to Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday, demanding a reduction in the GST rates on the substitutes for the banned single-use plastic items. "This will reduce, to some extent, the challenges being faced by the users and the manufacturers," Rai wrote in the letter.

296.title: Retail inflation eases marginally to 7.01% in June
296.article_body: The country’s retail inflation, which is measured by the Consumer Price Index (CPI), eased to 7.01% in the month of June. It stood at 7.04% in May. This comes amid easing crude and edible oil prices. Further, India's factory output, measured in terms of Index of Industrial Production (IIP), witnessed a growth of 19.6% in May.

297.title: Varun, Janhvi visit Auschwitz Camp in Poland to prep for 'Bawaal'
297.article_body: Actors Varun Dhawan and Janhvi Kapoor visited the Auschwitz Camp in Poland as part of their preparation for Nitesh Tiwari directorial 'Bawaal'. Auschwitz was the largest concentration camp under Nazi Germany's rule. The actors visited like tourists and heard the history of World War 2 in a pre-recorded tape. The film is reportedly in the last stage of shooting.

298.title: Wow! Great moment: Nadal reacts to Djokovic's post from Wimbledon court
298.article_body: Rafael Nadal has congratulated Novak Djokovic for winning his seventh Wimbledon title. Djokovic had posted a video on Instagram, wherein his children can be seen running on the Wimbledon court. Nadal commented on the post, saying, "Wow! Great moment. Enjoy it and many congrats!" Nadal had pulled out of the tournament before the semifinal due to an abdominal injury.

299.title: Peace, stability shouldn't be disturbed in Darjeeling: Mamata Banerjee
299.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday called for peace and stability in Darjeeling. She was speaking at the swearing-in ceremony of the elected members of the Gorkhaland Territorial Administration (GTA), where elections were held after a gap of 10 years. "If few leaders try to instigate violence, don't allow them to do so," Mamata Banerjee said.

300.title: Delhi Police arrest man tasked with killing rival gang's members
300.article_body: The Delhi Police's Crime Branch on Tuesday claimed to have averted a possible gang war with the arrest of a man who was allegedly directed to eliminate gangster Neeraj Bawania and his gang members. The accused was also involved in the 2017 killing of gangster Kala Aasodiya, the uncle of Bawania while being produced in a Jhajjar court.

301.title: 4 killed, 11 injured in 2 separate road accidents in Odisha
301.article_body: Four people were killed and 11 got injured in two separate road accidents in Odisha's Subarnapur and Khordha districts. In the first accident in Subarnapur, a car rammed into a parked autorickshaw and a motorbike leading to the death of three people. In another accident, one person was killed after a truck collided with a passenger bus, police said.

302.title: Shiv Sena will support NDA's Presidential candidate Murmu: Uddhav Thackeray
302.article_body: Shiv Sena will support Droupadi Murmu for Presidential elections, the party's chief Uddhav Thackeray announced on Tuesday. This came after Sena MP and spokesperson Sanjay Raut had said, "Supporting Droupadi Murmu does not mean supporting BJP." He said Sena shared a "good relationship" with Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha but will not act "under pressure".

303.title: Aren't Muslims Indian natives?: Owaisi on Yogi's 'population' remark
303.article_body: AIMIM's Asaduddin Owaisi on Tuesday criticised UP CM Yogi Adityanath's "population imbalance" remark. "Are Muslims not natives of India? If we see the reality, natives are only tribals and Dravidian(s)," Owaisi said. His remarks come after Yogi said population control measures shouldn't cause imbalance in population growth percentages between 'mool nivasi' (native residents) and other communities.

304.title: Chhattisgarh panchayat offers ₹1 lakh to minor girl raped by 4 men
304.article_body: A minor girl was raped by 4 men in Chhattisgarh, following which the panchayat tried to bury the matter and ordered the accused to pay the survivor ₹1 lakh, police said on Tuesday. The accused intercepted the 16-year-old, who was returning from a wedding and took her to a nearby forest and raped her, Jashpur ASP Pratibha Pandey said.

305.title: Ukraine claims long-range rocket strike on Russian-held territory
305.article_body: Ukraine on Tuesday claimed that it had carried out a long-range rocket strike against Russian forces in Ukraine's Kherson region. Ukraine said that 52 Russians were killed in the attack, but a Russian-installed official in Kherson put the death toll at seven. This comes as Ukraine plans to retake its occupied regions in a counter-offensive.

306.title: Time to look beyond Shardul, Vihari, Gill: Ghavri on India's Test team
306.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Karsan Ghavri said it's time to look beyond Hanuma Vihari, Shardul Thakur and Shubman Gill in India's Test side. "Sarfaraz Khan and Suryakumar Yadav need to be drafted into the Test team as soon as possible. They're the future stars of Indian cricket," he added. India last played a Test, the rescheduled fifth Test against England, in Birmingham.

307.title: Seven injured including school children after bus hits 4 vehicles in Kolkata
307.article_body: Seven people were injured including four school children after a bus hit four separate vehicles in south Kolkata's Bakultala area. The bus hit an autorickshaw from behind and two others at around 8 am, police said. The local mob vandalised the bus and alleged that the bus driver was drunk and was driving quite recklessly, police added.

308.title: SpiceJet Dubai-Madurai flight nose wheel malfunctions, airline's 9th glitch in 24 days
308.article_body: A Dubai-Madurai SpiceJet flight was delayed on Monday after the plane's nose wheel malfunctioned at the last minute, DGCA officials said as per PTI. Confirming the issue, the airline said it sent an "alternate aircraft" to bring passengers back to India. This is reportedly the ninth technical fault that a SpiceJet flight has faced in 24 days.

309.title: Jaishankar's visit to Kerala aimed at 2024 LS polls: Vijayan
309.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan said External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar's three-day visit to the state is aimed at the 2024 Lok Sabha polls. "It was heard that...responsibility to ensure BJP's victory in...Lok Sabha seat was entrusted to Jaishankar," Vijayan said. "When...a [foreign] minister [goes] to inspect the flyover at Kazhakuttom, the people can...[see] real intention behind it," he added.

310.title: Biden will push for more oil output on Middle East visit: US NSA
310.article_body: President Joe Biden will urge leaders of OPEC nations to increase oil production when he meets them in Saudi Arabia this week, US NSA Jake Sullivan said on Monday. Biden will depart on Tuesday night for his first trip to the Middle East as president. Besides Saudi Arabia, Biden will visit Israel and the West Bank during his trip.

311.title: Moved to UK overnight: Agarwal on how he became 1st Indian to list firm in London market
311.article_body:
Vedanta Chairman Anil Agarwal posted an old picture and shared how he became the first Indian
to list his firm on the London Stock Exchange in 2003. He wrote, "My wife...thought I was crazy when I told her that we are moving to London overnight...I didn't have much when I arrived...but had...the...blessings of my margdarshak (guide)- my parents."

312.title: Had arranged marriage, met husband on matrimonial site: Amruta Pawar
312.article_body: Marathi television actress Amruta Pawar has revealed that her marriage with biomedical engineer Neel Patil was an arranged one. “We met on a matrimonial site. We started speaking in January and it was a courtship of six months,” the actress added. Amruta and Neel got married recently in July and announced their engagement in April.

313.title: Deepika Padukone-backed Mokobara raises $6.5 mn in Series A round
313.article_body: Luggage brand Mokobara, backed by Deepika Padukone, has raised $6.5 million in its Series A funding round. The round, led by Saama Capital and Sauce VC, saw participation from investors such as Mamaearth Co-founder Varun Alagh, Urban Ladder Co-founder Ashish Goel, and founders of Licious, among others. The D2C brand was founded in 2019 by Navin Parwal and Sangeet Agrawal.

314.title: Ice-cream that doesn't melt when exposed to fire raises food safety concerns in China
314.article_body: A luxury Chinese ice-cream brand has revealed that their products don't melt at high temperatures. When exposed to fire, the ice-cream appeared to burn instead, prompting both customers and local authorities to ask what's in the dessert. Although the company, Zhong Xue Gao, stated its products are in line with quality standards, an officer said the matter is being investigated.

315.title: EU has frozen $13.8 bn of Russian assets over Ukraine war: Official
315.article_body: The European Union has frozen Russian assets worth $13.8 billion held by Russian oligarchs, other people and entities sanctioned for Moscow's war against Ukraine, EU Justice Commissioner Didier Reynders said. "A...large part, over 12 billion comes from five member states," he added. The bloc currently has 98 entities and nearly 1,160 individuals blacklisted for Russia's role in Ukraine.

316.title: India announce their playing XI for 1st ODI against England, Kohli out due to injury
316.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bowl first against England in the first ODI. At the toss, Rohit revealed that Virat Kohli will not feature in the match due to a niggle. Shreyas Iyer will bat at the number three position for India. Meanwhile, Shikhar Dhawan is featuring in his 150th ODI.

317.title: Neymar is as good as Cristiano Ronaldo and Messi, if not better: Cicinho
317.article_body: Talking about Neymar, ex-Real Madrid defender Cicinho said the Paris Saint-Germain (PSG) forward is as good as Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo and teammate Lionel Messi, if not better. PSG bought Neymar from Barcelona in 2017. In the last five years, Neymar has won every major trophy in France and has scored 100 goals for the Paris-based club.

318.title: Delhi Police to deploy 2,000 personnel for Kanwar Yatra; release route map
318.article_body: Over 2,000 traffic personnel will be deployed by the Delhi Police to ensure smooth flow of traffic especially across the capital's east and northeast districts during the Kanwar Yatra. Also, 338 Kanwariya camps have been approved out of which 172 are government approved, police said. Notably, the police have also released a route map for vehicular movement during the procession.

319.title: CISF jawan loses ₹1.5 lakh while updating Aadhaar card in Navi Mumbai
319.article_body: A 36-year-old CISF jawan was cheated of ₹1.50 lakh while he was trying to update his Aadhaar card online in Navi Mumbai. "Before linking, he had to update...Aadhaar card and...he did a Google search on the nearest centres," police said. He then received an SMS, asking him to download an application, after which the money was deducted from his account.

320.title: Stalker stabs class 12 girl in Madhya Pradesh's Jhansi
320.article_body: A class 12 girl was reportedly stabbed by her stalker outside her tutor's home in Jhansi. She has been hospitalised with deep wounds on her neck and face. The girl's mother alleged that the accused had been harassing and stalking her daughter for two years. Police said that both of them knew each other and used to talk on phone.

321.title: Sri Lankans turn to bicycles for commute amid soaring fuel prices
321.article_body: Several Sri Lankans are purchasing bicycles for their daily commute amid soaring fuel prices due to the country's economic crisis. Many bicycle stores in the country have run out of stock and several others have recorded a spike in sales. The current price of petrol in the country is LKR 470/litre, while diesel is priced at LKR 460/litre.

322.title: Man who broke into CM Mamata's house had 11 SIM cards, visited Bangladesh
322.article_body: The man who was arrested for entering the premises of West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's residence by crossing over a wall, was found to be possessing at least 11 SIM cards, police said. The 30-year-old accused allegedly used them to make calls to Bihar, Jharkhand and Bangladesh and had also visited Bangladesh without valid documents last year.

323.title: Novak better than Nadal, Federer across parameters: Ex-US Open winner
323.article_body: Former US Open winner Nikola Pilic said Novak Djokovic is better than Rafael Nadal and Roger Federer by all parameters. "He was the number one player in the world for 374 weeks which is impressive. Also, no one except him has won all the Grand Slam titles twice, and Novak has a positive head-to-head with almost all players," added Pilic.

324.title: Official arrested for seeking ₹1.5 lakh bribe from sarpanch in MP
324.article_body: A revenue official in Madhya Pradesh's Shivpuri district was arrested on Tuesday for allegedly seeking a bribe of ₹1.5 lakh from a man who was elected as a village sarpanch. The official, Sudhakar Tiwari, demanded the bribe in exchange of issuing the victory certificate to the complainant, who recently won the panchayat election by five votes.

325.title: Number of Assam residents killed in Manipur landslide rises to 15
325.article_body: The number of Assam residents killed in the landslide in Manipur's Noney district has risen to 15, an official said on Tuesday. Bodies of two persons from Assam's Morigaon district, engaged as labourers at Tupul railway yard construction site, were retrieved from under the debris on Monday, he said. Another six people from Assam are still missing, the official added.

326.title: Pune records season’s wettest day on Tuesday, on red alert till Thursday
326.article_body: Pune, on Tuesday recorded the season's wettest day with Shivajinagar observatory recording 46 mm of rainfall in the last 24 hours. Reports said the India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a red alert for Pune district till Thursday. Warning of possibilities of extremely heavy rainfall at isolated places, mainly in the ghat areas till July 14, has also been issued.

327.title: I stay off the internet: Camila on dealing with scrutiny post breakup with Shawn
327.article_body: Speaking about how she's protecting herself from public comments post her breakup with Shawn Mendes, Camila Cabello said, "It's the same way I protect my emotions with everything else." "I...stay off [the internet]. I don't look at what anyone says and wait for time to do its thing," she added. Camila said romantic relationships aren't her priority at the moment.

328.title: SRK's 'Dunki' DOP quits film due to 'creative differences' with Hirani
328.article_body: Amit Roy, DOP (Director of Photography) of Shah Rukh Khan-starrer 'Dunki', has quit the project due to "creative differences" with director Rajkumar Hirani. "We both couldn't see from the same angle," Amit told Etimes. "But...the parting was very amicable. We both sat down and then I quit. Honestly, I didn't want it to reach a stage of friction," he added.

329.title: Watch clearly, didn't speak wrongly with Rohit: Pratik on misbehaviour reports
329.article_body: Actor Pratik Sehajpal took to Twitter to share a statement over reports of him misbehaving with filmmaker Rohit Shetty on 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12'. "Please watch the episode clearly! Not once did I speak wrong[ly] with Rohit sir...I really respect him...I'm grateful to God that I got chance to even meet him...I was talking to someone else," he wrote.

330.title: Thane man gets 10 yrs in jail for sexually assaulting 7-yr-old girl
330.article_body: A special court sentenced 26-year-old Sajad Aslam Kankali to 10 years of rigorous imprisonment for kidnapping and sexually assaulting a seven-year-old girl in Thane. The judge also imposed a fine of ₹13,000 on him. The incident took place in 2015, when the accused abducted the minor, took her to a forested area and sexually assaulted her, special public prosecutor said.

331.title: Will defend Philippines if it's attacked in South China Sea: US
331.article_body: As part of the 1951 US-Philippines Mutual Defense Treaty, the US will defend the Philippines if Philippine forces come under attack in the South China Sea, US State Secretary Antony Blinken said on Monday. Blinken's comments came on the sixth anniversary of a 2016 ruling by an international tribunal that invalidated Beijing's vast claims in the South China Sea.

332.title: Govt forms new trade advisory body; onboards TCS CEO, KKR India chief
332.article_body: The government has constituted a new Board of Trade, an advisory body to the Commerce and Industry Ministry. The 29-member board has been constituted by merging it with the existing Council for Trade Development and Promotion (CTDP), a notification by the Directorate General of Foreign Trade announced. The body includes TCS CEO Rajesh Gopinathan and KKR India Chairman Sanjay Nayyar.

333.title: Why has Supreme Court told govt to consider enacting a 'Bail Act'?
333.article_body: The Supreme Court said that the Centre should consider the enactment of a separate bail law or 'Bail Act' to "streamline the grant of bails". Over two-thirds of prison inmates in India are undertrial prisoners, a majority of whom may not be required to be arrested, SC said. A democracy can't give the impression of a "police state", it added.

334.title: Jayeshbhai Jordaar's fate shouldn't be judged by its box office: Director
334.article_body: 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' director Divyang Thakkar spoke about the film's underwhelming performance at the box office and said, "[Its] fate shouldn't be judged by...box office." "Audience these days is interested in going to theatres only for...larger-than-life experiences," he added. Divyang further said he's happy that the film found its audience through OTT.

335.title: Sena hasn't extended its support to anyone: NCP on Prez elections
335.article_body: Maharashtra NCP leader Chhagan Bhujbal on Tuesday said that the Shiv Sena has not extended its support to anyone in the upcoming Presidential elections. "It is yet to make the final decision," Bhujbal said. This comes after Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said that the party discussed NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu in their meeting on Monday.

336.title: Assam Police recover 497 kg ganja from truck, miscreants set vehicle on fire
336.article_body: The police recovered 497 kg of ganja from a truck in Assam's Srirampur on Monday, following which the empty vehicle, which was parked near a police outpost, was set on fire by some miscreants at night. The truck's driver was arrested by the police. A police official said that firefighters were able to bring the blaze under control.

337.title: Video of fake IPL in Gujarat that was created to cheat Russian punters goes viral
337.article_body: A video of fake IPL in Gujarat that was organised to cheat Russian punters has gone viral. The clip that has gone viral showed how the camera displayed just one angle of the match. Several labourers acted as players for the fake IPL, which was broadcast on YouTube. Russian punters used to place bets on the tournament through Telegram.

338.title: We always discuss what we're reading: Sara on bonding with dad over books
338.article_body: Actress Sara Ali Khan opened up about how she and her actor-father, Saif Ali Khan, bond over history and books, and said that they always tell each other what they are reading. "He recommended Anna Karenina to me, but I read...classics...from Odyssey to Inferno. I told my father about them and...he got them all and started reading too," she added.

339.title: Ajay is a deeply intense & private man, Akshay is a lot of fun: Johar
339.article_body: Talking about Ajay Devgn and Akshay Kumar, filmmaker Karan Johar said, "Ajay's a deeply intense, private...silent man, but he'll say one word and it'll be impactful...He says one line and that...will be a trending line." "Akshay is a lot of fun...His episode with Samantha Ruth Prabhu [in the seventh season of 'Koffee with Karan'] is [a] riot," added Johar.

340.title: Shami has good opportunity in England ODIs to vouch for T20 WC spot: Parthiv
340.article_body: Ex-wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel has said pacer Mohammad Shami has a good opportunity in England ODIs to vouch for his spot in India's squad for the 2022 T20 World Cup. "India already have Bhuvneshwar and Bumrah...if you get the quality and experience of Shami, it'll make a huge difference," stated Parthiv. Shami last played T20Is in the 2021 T20 World Cup.

341.title: Humanity closer than ever to irreversible climate breakdown: Expert
341.article_body: Sir James Bevan, the head of the Environment Agency, has warned that 60 years on, humanity is closer than ever to irreversible climate breakdown. Moreover, as per a report, a quarter of England's mammals are facing extinction. "The biodiversity crisis is a crisis because it won't just kill...plants and animals it is killing, it will kill us too," Bevan said.

342.title: Indian Railways' AC double decker coach runs at 180 kmph, video surfaces
342.article_body: Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw took to Twitter to share a video of an LHB AC double decker coach clocking a speed of 180 kmph during a trial. He wrote, "New speed of New India. Trial conducted for 180 kmph." The speed trial was successfully conducted on Kota-Nagda section of West Central Railway.

343.title: 2 booked for rape after minor Punjab girl found 4 months pregnant
343.article_body: Two unidentified men were booked for raping a 17-year-old girl after she was found to be four months pregnant. The incident came to light when the girl was taken to hospital after complaining about stomach ache. The girl claimed that accused had sedated and raped her and threatened to make the video viral if she didn't pay them ₹1 lakh.

344.title: Rupee closes at all-time low of 79.60 against US dollar
344.article_body: The Indian rupee ended at a record low of 79.60 (provisional) against the US dollar on Tuesday. The currency witnessed an intra-day high of 79.53 and a low of 79.66 against the US dollar in Tuesday’s trade. Meanwhile, the euro reached parity with the US dollar for the first time in 20 years on Tuesday.

345.title: Pics show waterlogging, traffic jam amid heavy rainfall in several parts of India
345.article_body: Waterlogging and traffic congestion was witnessed in several parts of the country, including Delhi, Mumbai, Uttar Pradesh and Gujarat, amid heavy rainfall. This comes as red alert has been issued in several areas of Gujarat and Maharashtra, with IMD predicting extremely heavy rainfall in the region. Extremely heavy rainfall has also been predicted over Goa.

346.title: Martin Scorsese screens Malayalam film 'Kummatty' at The Film Foundation
346.article_body: Filmmaker Martin Scorsese screened 1979 Malayalam film 'Kummatty' at his 'The Film Foundation' on Monday. The Aravindan Govindan directorial was restored and showcased in The Film Foundation Restoration Screening Room. The filmmaker wrote on Instagram, "KUMMATTY is an adaptation of a Central Kerala folktale...A sweet and engaging story and a visually stunning film, KUMMATTY is a must-see."

347.title: GHMC asks citizens to plan commute accordingly amid rainfall in Hyderabad
347.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation's (GHMC) Enforcement, Vigilance and Disaster Management (EVDM) wing on Tuesday asked citizens to plan their commute accordingly amid rainfall in the city. It also issued an alert for moderate rainfall along with gusty winds in Hyderabad for next 12 hours. "Tree falls may be expected. DRF teams on high alert," EVDM Director tweeted.

348.title: TMC MP questions Smriti Irani's appointment as Minority Affairs Minister, Rijiju responds
348.article_body: Questioning Minority Affairs Minister Smriti Irani's appointment, TMC MP Jawhar Sircar tweeted, "Hardcore Hindu, married to a Parsi given charge of Muslims, Christians. Is this BJP's secularism?" Kiren Rijiju replied, Muslims, Sikhs, Christians, Buddhists, Jain and Parsis are all minority communities, adding, "I hope one can free mind from the shackles of pseudo secularism & appeasement politics."

349.title: CSK, MI, DC show interest in bids for South Africa's new T20 league
349.article_body: Cricket South Africa has invited bids from interested parties for an upcoming T20 competition in the country. The board has received 29 expressions of interest till now which include Chennai Super Kings, Mumbai Indians, Delhi Capitals, owners of Pakistan Super League franchises and a party led by former English cricketer Kevin Pietersen. CSA plans to hold the tournament in January-February.

350.title: BJP has nothing to do with 'rebellion' in Goa Congress: Goa CM
350.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Tuesday said the BJP has nothing to do with the "rebellion" in the state Congress Legislature Party. Congress had accused MLA Michael Lobo and former CM Digambar Kamat of "conspiring and hobnobbing" with the ruling BJP to engineer a split in the party's legislative wing. On Sunday, five Congress MLAs in Goa had gone incommunicado.

351.title: 2 Ghaziabad men held for cheating people who wanted to book OYO rooms
351.article_body: The Noida Police arrested two Ghaziabad-based members of a gang for allegedly cheating people on the pretext of booking rooms in OYO Hotels and recovered ₹79,000 cash from them. The accused would somehow access the data of victims by posing as OYO Hotel staff and would ask them to transfer the booking amount for the rooms to the bank account.

352.title: PM to attend 1st India-Israel-UAE-US leaders' virtual meet on July 14
352.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will attend the first I2U2 (India-Israel-UAE-US) Leaders' Virtual Summit on July 14. Besides PM Modi, US President Joe Biden, Israeli PM Yair Lapid and UAE President Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan will participate in the summit. Notably, the summit will be held during Biden's four-day tour of the Middle East.

353.title: Officer gets show-cause notice for serving poor quality tea to MP CM
353.article_body: A junior civil supplies officer was on Tuesday served a show-cause notice for serving poor quality and cold tea to Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan during a visit to Khajuraho, an officer said. According to the notice, MP CM, along with some other guests, were served tea at Khajuraho airport on Monday, while campaigning for a civic body election.

354.title: Italy to start administering 2nd COVID-19 booster shot to over-60s
354.article_body: Italy will soon start administering a second COVID-19 booster shot to people aged over 60, Health Minister Roberto Speranza said. This comes after EU health agencies recommended the second booster dose for vulnerable people and those over 60. "All...scientific evidence...shows that an extra booster dose can greatly protect people, especially the frail and elderly, from hospitalisation," he added.

355.title: Kartik, Nushrratt, Sonnalli attend 'Pyaar...' co-star Ishita's b'day party
355.article_body: 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama 2' actors Kartik Aaryan, Omkar Kapoor, Sunny Singh, Nushrratt Bharuccha and Sonnalli Seygall reunited in Mumbai for co-star Ishita Raj's birthday on Monday. Nushrratt and Sonnalli took to their respective Instagram handles to share some pictures from the party. 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama 2' was a comedy-drama film directed by Luv Ranjan.

356.title: Samantha refused to use body doubles for action scenes in Yashoda: Makers
356.article_body: Director duo Hari Shankar and Haresh Narayan revealed that Samantha Ruth Prabhu refused to take any help for action scenes in her upcoming movie 'Yashoda'. "She wanted to do all the scenes herself. She...said no to body doubles...and even in a few scenes where...rope is required for safety, she did it on her own...She was totally enjoying it," they said.

357.title: Debt mutual funds see outflow of ₹92,248 cr in June: AMFI data
357.article_body: Mutual funds that invest in fixed-income securities, or debt funds, saw an outflow of ₹92,248 crore in June, Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI) data showed. Debt funds saw a net outflow of ₹32,722 crore in May and an inflow of ₹54,756 crore in April. Out of 16 fixed-income or debt fund categories, 14 witnessed net outflows in June.

358.title: Many Shiv Sena leaders, workers in touch with us: Maha CM Shinde
358.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde has claimed that many Shiv Sena leaders and workers are "in touch" with his faction. "The Deputy CM handled the government very well during his tenure as CM...Many people have faith in the government," Shinde added. This comes after Union Minister Raosaheb Patil Danve claimed 12 Shiv Sena MPs are in touch with Shinde's faction.

359.title: Supply chain startup Wheelocity raises $12 mn in Series A round
359.article_body: Early-stage supply chain startup Wheelocity, which handles fresh food supply for quick commerce companies, has raised $12 million in its Series A funding round. The funding round, which was a mix of debt and equity, was led by Lightspeed India Partners and saw participation from Anicut Capital and other investors. Wheelocity's clients include Swiggy Instamart, Dunzo, Blinkit, among others.

360.title: Mumbai professor rapes student at college, home for 2 yrs; arrested
360.article_body: A 42-year-old college professor has been arrested by Mumbai Police for allegedly raping his student for two years. Police said the accused allegedly raped her and forced her to perform unnatural sex in the college premises and at his home when she came for tuition between 2020 and 2022. The student was a minor when she was allegedly sexually assaulted.

361.title: Man slits woman's throat after argument inside Pune hotel room, held
361.article_body: A 30-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly killing a woman inside a hotel room in Pune, police said on Monday. The accused, identified as Sachin Raju Shinde, allegedly slit the victim's throat following an argument between them. The accused told police that the victim was demanding money from him and pressuring him to marry her.

362.title: 86 Chinese cities issue red alert after heatwave buckles roads
362.article_body: As many as 86 cities in China, including commercial capital Shanghai, have issued red alerts amid soaring temperatures due to the ongoing heatwave. The hot weather has buckled roads, popped roof tiles and driven people to seek refuge in underground raid shelters in many cities. China's Chongqing city has also deployed sanitation water-spraying trucks to keep its roads cool.

363.title: Hindu activists enter B'luru's Idgah Maidan to protest, detained
363.article_body: Bengaluru City Police has detained Hindu activists who entered the Idgah Maidan as part of a bandh called by the Chamarajpet Citizens' Federation on Tuesday. The activists claimed that the ground is for the public and not a property of the Waqf Board, limited for Muslims to offer prayers. DCP (West) said no permission was granted to hold the bandh.

364.title: 16-yr-old Chhattisgarh boy beaten to death in school; 4 minors detained
364.article_body: A 16-year-old student was beaten to death allegedly by four boys at a government school in Chhattisgarh's Raipur after a verbal fight over a petty issue, police said. Following the incident, four minor boys were detained, police added. The victim had gone to the school to appear in a Class 10 compartment exam, police further said.

365.title: Delhi Police arrests man, wife and daughter for holding dual passports
365.article_body: Delhi Police has arrested a man, his wife and their daughter, all residents of West Bengal, for allegedly holding dual passports. This comes after a complaint was filed against the accused by immigration officials for having French and Indian passports. "They disclosed themselves as Bangladeshi nationals and procured French passports...they paid ₹9 lakh to an agent," police said.

366.title: Now there's campaign for Tiranga to be flown from every home: Big B
366.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan recalled how he started hoisting the National Flag at his residence Jalsa on his blog. He wrote MP Naveen Jindal moved the court for the Tiranga to be hoisted at residential locations and won. "Immediately I started flying our National Flag...Now there's a campaign for it to be flown from every home with pride," the actor added.

367.title: Won't be surprised if England score 400 vs India: Vaughan on 1st ODI
367.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan said he "won't be surprised" if England score 400 in the first ODI against India. "England scored 498 against Netherlands...[and will be strong]," added Vaughan. England's white-ball skipper Jos Buttler earlier stated that they'll keep trying to score 500 runs in ODIs. England recently recorded their highest-ever total against India in T20Is, scoring 215 runs.

368.title: Pune traffic department collects ₹30 cr fine in 6 months using CCTVs
368.article_body: Pune traffic department has collected fines amounting to ₹30 crore using its CCTV camera surveillance system since January this year, police said. As many as 5.71 lakh violators were fined after they were spotted in the CCTV camera surveillance system. The fine recovered in June 2022 was ₹2.82 crore as compared to the monthly average of over ₹5 crore.

369.title: Unidentified people damage idol at temple in J&K's Kathua, FIR filed
369.article_body: An FIR was registered after some unidentified people allegedly damaged an idol at a temple in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua, police said. Following the incident that took place on Monday, angry locals launched a protest and blocked the main road, demanding arrest of the culprits, police added. It's reportedly the third such incident in Jammu in the past three months.

370.title: Dog beaten, tied to a bomb by Russian soldiers to kill its rescuers in Ukraine
370.article_body: Russian soldiers beat a dog and tied it to a bomb to kill Ukrainian civilians coming to its rescue. Residents in Makariv, north west of Kyiv, called Ukrainian bomb disposal experts to rescue the canine. The dog, whose owner could not be found, has been named Fox and is making a recovery.

371.title: Euro reaches parity with US dollar for the first time in 20 years
371.article_body: The euro sank on Tuesday to reach parity with US dollar for the first time in 20 years. The currency fell to an intraday low of $1 amid concerns that an energy crisis could plunge the region's economy into recession. The concerns come after the biggest single pipeline carrying Russian natural gas to Europe was shutdown for maintenance.

372.title: Thank you Sri Lanka for hosting us during an extremely difficult time: Warner
