372.article_body: After the conclusion of Australia's tour of Sri Lanka, David Warner shared a picture of the Sri Lankan flag and thanked the country for hosting them amid the economic and political crisis. "What I love about your amazing country is no matter the circumstances you always have a smile on your face and are always so welcoming," wrote Warner.

373.title: KL Rahul to marry Athiya Shetty in next 3 months in Mumbai: Reports
373.article_body: Cricketer KL Rahul will tie the knot with actress Athiya Shetty in the next three months, as per reports. "The wedding is expected to take place in next three months in Mumbai. It'll be a grand celebration for both families and every detail of...wedding is been overseen by the bride herself," India Today reported quoting a source as saying.

374.title: Govt releases list of 4 participants of India's 1st 5G spectrum auction
374.article_body: The Centre has released a list naming Adani Data Networks, Reliance Jio, Bharti Airtel and Vodafone Idea as the participants of India’s first 5G spectrum auction which will be held on July 26. A total of 72,097.85 MHz of airwaves will be auctioned and the winner will have the right to use the spectrum for 20 years.

375.title: Outlandish: Depp's lawyers on Heard asking for dismissal of trial verdict
375.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp's lawyers have called his ex-wife Amber Heard's request to dismiss the verdict of the defamation trial "outlandish". Heard's team had alleged that the wrong juror sat during the trial. Depp's team has argued that Heard's team should have spoken up at the time of the trial if they had concerns, adding that the juror was vetted.

376.title: Suryakumar has to play in 1st ODI vs England: Michael Vaughan
376.article_body: Former England captain Michael Vaughan has said Suryakumar Yadav has to play in the first ODI against England. "Suryakumar just played the most ridiculous innings," he added, referring to the 31-year-old's 117-run innings in the final T20I against England. "India have got so much quality and depth that they have just got to get the combinations right," Vaughan further said.

377.title: Secretary of Swapna Suresh's NGO arrested for threatening tribals in Kerala
377.article_body: Secretary of an NGO named High Range Rural Development Society (HRDS) which had employed Swapna Suresh, the key accused in Kerala's gold smuggling case, was arrested for allegedly threatening tribals in Palakkad. The Sholayur Police arrested the accused, Aji Krishnan, based on a complaint filed by a local tribal member. Notably, Krishnan has been booked under the SC/ST Atrocities Act.

378.title: Pune civic body to appoint agency to check green growth on bridges
378.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has floated a tender to appoint an agency to clear city bridges of green growth. "The agency appointed...will use crane(s) and other machinery to clear the plant growth as bridges are tall. The agency will use chemicals to check green growth," a PMC official said. PMC will also appoint an agency for the maintenance of bridges.

379.title: House of accused in Assam animal rights activist suicide case demolished
379.article_body: The house of Baidullah Khan, an accused in animal rights activist Vineet Bagaria's suicide case, was demolished on Tuesday by authorities in Assam's Dibrugarh. "The house was constructed without having the necessary building permits. The structure was unstable and unfit for people to reside," Dibrugarh DC said. Bagaria had died by suicide at his residence on July 7.

380.title: Father of school shooting victim shouts at US President during his speech; video surfaces
380.article_body: US President Joe Biden was heckled by the father of a school shooting victim during a White House event on Monday. Biden was talking about passage of a gun control bill when Manuel Oliver, whose son died in Parkland, Florida, in 2018, shouted that the US President must "do more". "Sit down...Let me finish my comments," Biden was heard saying.

381.title: Water level rises in 7 lakes used for supplying water to Mumbai
381.article_body: The water level has increased in the seven lakes supplying water to Mumbai due to continuous heavy rainfall. The combined water stock of all seven lakes has shot up to 5.8 lakh million litres of their total capacity or 40% of the annual total. The seven lakes are - Modak Sagar, Tansa, Vihar, Tulsi, Upper Vaitarna, Middle Vaitarna and Bhatsa.

382.title: Truck hits vehicle parked to change tyre in Punjab; 3 dead, 1 hurt
382.article_body: Three people were killed and one person was injured after a canter truck rammed into a pick-up truck parked on the roadside and its occupants who were changing the vehicle's tyre in Punjab's Dera Bassi on Monday. The deceased included the canter truck's driver. The canter truck's front was left completely damaged from the impact of the collision.

383.title: I learnt some incredible personal life lessons from Brad Pitt: Joey King
383.article_body: During her interview with Men's Journal, Joey King said Brad Pitt's 'Bullet Train' is "a larger-than-life film" that the actress can't believe she's a part of. "I learnt a lot from Brad, some incredible personal life lessons. He's been in the public eye for so long," she added. "Brad was so gracious in helping someone like me," she said.

384.title: My focus is definitely on 2023 WC: Dhawan ahead of 1st ODI vs England
384.article_body: Ahead of first India-England ODI, India opener Shikhar Dhawan said he has been practising for England ODIs and he's sure he'll be in fine rhythm in coming matches. "My focus is definitely on next year's World Cup...for that, I want to play as many matches as possible for India and do well there," he added. Match will be played today.

385.title: Former Himachal Pradesh BJP chief Khimi Ram joins Congress
385.article_body: Former Himachal Pradesh BJP chief Khimi Ram joined the Congress on Tuesday. Ram, a former minister and deputy speaker in the state, said he is not joining the Congress "out of any anger towards BJP". "I have taken a well-thought-out decision to take...Congress forward in Himachal Pradesh," Ram said. He was sworn in at AICC headquarters in New Delhi.

386.title: National flag temporarily removed from Hyd's tallest post to prevent damage
386.article_body: The Hyderabad authority has temporarily taken down the national flag from the tallest flag post in the city to prevent it from any damage amid the strong winds forecast for the city. The height of the flag post, located on the banks of Hussain Sagar Lake in Sanjeevaiah Park, is around 88 metres and it weighs over 65 kilograms.

387.title: The first-known pregnant mummy had cancer, reveals new study
387.article_body: A new study by Polish scientists said that the first-known pregnant Egyptian mummy had cancer in the nasopharynx (upper part of the throat behind the nose). The revelations were made when unusual markings were found in the nasopharyngeal bones of the mummy's skull. The woman is suspected to have had a malignant tumour and likely died from it, researchers said.

388.title: 5 districts in Delhi report deficient monsoon rains so far: IMD
388.article_body: Five districts in Delhi have reported deficient monsoon rains so far this year due to poor rainfall distribution, the IMD data stated. West Delhi and Southwest Delhi have recorded a rainfall deficit of 60% and 51%, respectively. On the other hand, Northeast Delhi has logged a shortfall of 43%, followed by Central Delhi at 29% and South Delhi at 22%.

389.title: Chivas Regal maker Pernod Ricard puts new India investments on hold: Report
389.article_body: French spirits group Pernod Ricard, the maker of Chivas Regal, Glenlivet Scotch whisky and Absolut vodka has put its new Indian investments on hold over long-running tax disputes with authorities on valuing liquor imports, as per a report. The company had also written a letter to PM Narendra Modi in November seeking a resolution in the matter.

390.title: PM Modi inaugurates Deoghar Airport in J'khand, flags off flight to Kolkata
390.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday inaugurated the 657-acre Deoghar Airport, constructed at a cost of ₹401 crore, in Jharkhand. The PM also flagged off the Deoghar-Kolkata IndiGo flight from the new airport, which has a 2,500-metre-long runway. Union Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya M Scindia said the airport will be linked to Ranchi, Patna and Delhi in the upcoming days.

391.title: No science to predict isolated extreme rain: Govt on Amarnath tragedy
391.article_body: After IMD said that the weather event at Amarnath was not a cloudburst but localised extreme rainfall, the Ministry of Earth Sciences Secretary Dr M Ravichandran said that no country has the science to make a forecast for such an event yet. "Just as there's no science to predict an earthquake, there's none for isolated extremely heavy rainfall," he said.

392.title: Japanese flock Tokyo streets to bid farewell to ex-PM Abe at funeral
392.article_body: Hundreds of Japanese citizens flocked streets of Tokyo to bid their final goodbyes to ex-PM Shinzo Abe on Tuesday as a private funeral service was held at a temple days after his assassination. The hearse carrying Abe's body passed through several significant buildings, including the Prime Minister's Office and parliament building. Abe will be cremated at city's Kirigaya Funeral Hall.

393.title: Russia reports its first case of monkeypox
393.article_body: Russia's consumer safety watchdog Rospotrebnadzor on Tuesday said that the country has detected its first case of monkeypox. "The infection was found in a young man who came back from a trip through European countries," it added. "The disease is proceeding in a mild form. There is no threat to life," it further said.

394.title: Lawrence Bishnoi bought ₹4 lakh rifle to kill Salman Khan in 2018: Report
394.article_body: Gangster Lawrence Bishnoi, who's being questioned in connection with Sidhu Moosewala's murder, has allegedly revealed during interrogation that he "wanted to kill" Salman Khan in 2018 over the 1998 blackbuck poaching case. According to a report, Bishnoi allegedly confessed to sending messages to his associate Sampat Nehra to kill Salman. The gangster reportedly also ordered a rifle for ₹4 lakh.

395.title: Cannot compare Suryakumar Yadav to AB de Villiers: Sanjay Manjrekar
395.article_body: Following Suryakumar Yadav's 117 in the third T20I against England comprising 14 fours and six sixes, Sanjay Manjrekar said Suryakumar cannot be compared to AB de Villiers. "AB did that many years back what Surya's doing currently," added Manjrekar. Suryakumar had a strike rate of 212.72. Parthiv Patel stated that it might be the best knock in India's T20I history.

396.title: Video of reverse waterfall in Maharashtra's Naneghat goes viral
396.article_body: A video of a reverse waterfall from Maharashtra's Naneghat has gone viral on social media. In the video, water can be seen sprawling upwards instead of falling down. Naneghat is a mountain pass between the Konkan coast and the ancient town of Junnar in Deccan plateau in the Western Ghats.

397.title: Which are the top 10 best cities in the world in 2022 as per Time Out?
397.article_body: As per the Time Out 2022 Index, Scotland's capital Edinburgh has been named the best city in the world. It is followed by Chicago, Medellin, Glasgow, Amsterdam, Prague and Marrakech. Berlin, Montreal and Copenhagen complete the top 10. Meanwhile, Mumbai has been ranked 14th, while Delhi has been ranked 26th.

398.title: Heroin worth more than ₹350 crore seized at Gujarat’s Mundra port
398.article_body: The anti-terrorist squad (ATS) of Gujarat and the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) seized more than 70 kg of heroin worth over ₹350 crore during a joint operation at Mundra port on Tuesday. Gujarat DGP Ashish Bhatia is likely to hold a press conference to share the details of the operation, The Indian Express reported.

399.title: Russian military equipment damaged in Ukraine go on display in Prague
399.article_body: Russian military equipment destroyed by Ukrainian Armed Forces amid the ongoing war has gone on display in the Czech Republic's capital, Prague. The exhibition features a damaged T-90 tank, Buk air defence system, Khosta self-propelled mortar, Msta howitzer and casings and fragments from rockets and missiles among other things. The exhibition was organised by Ukraine's Interior Ministry.

400.title: Social activist Medha Patkar booked for misusing donation funds
400.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh police have booked social activist Medha Patkar and 11 others for allegedly misleading people to donate to her trust for the welfare of the people of Narmada valley. The FIR also accuses them of misusing the funds for political and anti-national agenda. "We have...audit report...for every question regarding the financial status," Patkar said while refuting the allegations.

401.title: ODI format is great to bring Virat Kohli back into form: RP Singh
401.article_body: Ahead of India's first ODI against England, ex-India pacer RP Singh has said that the 50-over format is great to bring Virat Kohli back into form. "There's not too much pressure of scoring, his fitness is great so he can rotate strike consistently. The demands are higher in the T20 format," explained Singh. The first ODI will be played today.
